description: History, development, and implementation of theories and practices associated with managing information environments.   FS: 10/05/2022.

name: Knowledge Work as an Organizational Asset
description: Introduction to the background, principles, practices, and technologies of knowledge management for library and information professionals.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Social Informatics
description: Examines the design, uses, and effects of information and communication technologies (ICTs) from the standpoint that society and technology mutually shape one another.   FS: 10/05/2022.

name: Information and Communication Needs and Assessment
description: An overview of the communication models, major concepts, trends, and other related issues of information transfer with a focus on information seeking and use in digital age.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Information Management for Journalists
description: Online resources specific to mass communications, research strategies, organization and creation of digital information.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: User-Centered Information Architecture
description: Processes and techniques for designing user-centered information systems on the Web. Issues of needs analysis, content development, cognitive models, human-computer interaction, interface design, and usability testing.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Knowledge Discovery
description: The students will review knowledge discovery basics concepts, techniques, tools, and applications. This course is project based and the students will develop new Wikipedia pages by reading papers in a selected domain.    FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Planning and Sustaining Digital Projects
description: Theoretical and technological foundations of building the digital information infrastructure. Emphasis on technical aspects of managing digital assets for Intranet and Internet use.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Competitive Intelligence
description: Strategies and techniques for locating competitive intelligence information.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Information Issues in Community Institutions
description: Problem of identifying or defining cultural heritage and the issues and problems in preserving, accessing, and managing cultural heritage information.  Issues such as copyright/ownership, technical problems of preservation and intellectual access, and the different ways in which libraries, archives, museums, zoos and other cultural heritage institutions operate.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Emerging Topics in Information Science
description: Examination of selected current and emerging topics in the field of information science. May be repeated once for credit as topics vary.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Independent Study in Information Science
description: Independent study in an area of information science relevant to the students professional goals. May be repeated once for credit as topics vary.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Internship in Information Science
description: Supervised field experience in an information agency relevant to students professional goals. Approval of the appropriate internship application must be submitted early in the semester preceding enrollment.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Teaching and Training in Distributed Environments
description: Knowledge and skills for applying complementary technologies for learning in distributed learning environments (Pre-K-lifelong) through lecture, demonstration, and discussion.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Materials for Early Childhood
description: Media resources and techniques for children from birth to 9 years. Reading interests and developmental needs of young children. Authors, illustrators, indexes, bibliographic tools, evaluation sources, and professional literature. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Materials for Children
description: Media resources for children. Reading interests of children and their curricular and independent needs for information. Authors, illustrators, indexes, bibliographic tools, and sources of evaluation of materials for children. Techniques and literature for read-aloud programs and storytelling. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Materials for Adolescents
description: Media resources for adolescents. Reading interests of adolescents and their curricular and independent information needs. Study of relationships of media to information needs and critical comparison between classic and contemporary materials for adolescents. Indexes, bibliographic tools, and sources of evaluation of materials. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Special Topics in Library and Information Studies
description: Specific topics of current concern to the library, information, and media professions to be identified by title. Not open to students enrolled in M.L.I.S. program.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Applications of Information Technology and the Infrastructure
description: Introductory knowledge for school library media specialists, teachers, administrators, parents, and other citizens interested in practical applications of information technology to support learning, decision making, and community building.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Knowledge Discovery Techniques
description: Knowledge discovery techniques and applications.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Information Visualization
description: Foster theoretical insights about data visualization. Prepare temporal, geospatial, and textual data for visual representations. In hands-on sessions, students practice data visualization techniques and apply them in a wide range of real-world scenarios.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Storytelling: Theory, Practice, and Development
description: Storytelling methods, techniques, and materials encompassing heritage, art, literature, and programming.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Information Behavior and Practices
description: Focuses on theories, models, and concepts of information behavior. Emphasizes information seeking and use practices and activities in relation particular communities, channels and barriers to information, and the impacts of technology. Provides an introduction to methods that can be used to study information needs, information seeking behavior, and related phenomena.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: News Literacy
description: Addresses the renewed phenomenon of fake news, misinformation/disinformation, and its related concepts; then focuses more explicitly on the affective information behaviors that influence our interactions with information and help us intellectually thrive in a post-truth society.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Ethics, Values, and Foundational Principles of Library and Information Science Professions
description: Introduction to the issues and core values of library and information professions, including equity of access, literacy and learning, information policy, collaboration, service, professional growth and development, and culturally responsive practice.   GC: 12/13/2021.

name: Leadership in Information Organizations
description: Introduction to the nature, development, roles, and fundamental issues of leadership in library and information organizations.   GC: 12/13/2021.

name: Research Design and Evaluation
description: Introduces the research process as applied to library and information science topics with an emphasis on research methods, critical evaluation, and the practical application of research.   GC: 12/13/2021.

name: Fundamentals of Data and Digital Communications
description: A comprehensive overview of data science basics and applications for communications. Introduces basic concepts, applications, and tools of data science for communication purposes. Includes basic theories and approaches in communications.    GC: 03/22/2021.

name: Design and Management of Databases
description: Databases used in libraries and other information agencies, including operational and functional design. Extensive hands-on evaluation of selected database software packages.   GC: 12/13/2021.

name: Internship in Library and Information Science
description: Supervised field experience in library, media center, or other information agency relevant to student€s professional goals.   GC: 04/25/2022.

name: Independent Study in Library and Information Science
description: Independent study in an area of library and information science relevant to the student€s professional goals.   GC: 04/25/2022.

name: Elementary Italian
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Basic Proficiency in Italian
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Accelerated Basic Proficiency in Italian
description: Accelerated development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills to obtain the Basic Proficiency Level in Italian.  Credit may be received only for one of the following:  ITAL 121 and ITAL 122, or ITAL 130.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Proficiency in Italian I
description: Practice and rapid development of accurate skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing. Features BBC television course.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Proficiency in Italian II
description: Practice and further rapid development of accurate skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing. Features BBC television course.   CL: 2020.

name: Accelerated Intermediate Italian
description: Accelerated development of intermediate level listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills in Italian.  Credit may be received only for one of the following: ITAL 221 and ITAL 222, or ITAL 230.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Italian Conversation
description: Oral practice with advanced protocols of Italian conversation, focusing on perfecting rhythms and tonalities, and on a clear presentation of meaning.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Writing in Italian
description: Introduction to letter, short essay, and creative writing, and to newspaper reports and selected essays as models of self-expression.

name: TEATROMANIA: Italian Theater Practicum
description: Project work in the production of plays in Italian. Includes readings in and public performance of Italian theatre and related materials.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: The Other Italians: Emigrants and Immigrants
description: Cultural analysis of the issues facing immigrants and their descendants in Italy, as well as the development of Italian American Culture in the United States. Through films, original texts, secondary literature, and contemporary media will be explored. Taught in English.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Advanced Italian Study Abroad
description: Intensive language practice, emphasizing oral proficiency skills and advanced conversational protocols. Classroom instruction by native speakers, extensive contact with native environment, field trips. May be repeated for credit by permission.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of Italian Literature I (1200-1850)
description: Introductory course of Italian Literature that covers canonical authors and key literary, cultural, and historical movements in Italy from 1200-1850.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Survey of Italian Literature II: 19th-21st Centuries
description: Survey of significant writers, works, and cultural movements in Italian Literature from 1850 to the present day.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study of selected literary and cinematic topics of the Italian world. May be repeated for credit as topic varies by title. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

name: Contemporary Italian Civilization
description: Significant values in the Italian cultural heritage, as presented in native print and visual media.   CL: 2020.

name: Italian Food Culture: Adaptability and Sustainability in Italian and Global Food Systems
description: Italian Culture Course on Italian and Global Foodways as studied through the lens of climate change and sustainability.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Twentieth Century Italian Literature
description: Selected plays, short stories, novels and poems which characterize quality achievements by Italians, and which promote a better understanding of Italian life.   CL: 2020.

name: The Italian Love Lyric
description: Italian love poetry, beginning with the "Dolce Stil Nuovo" of the late Middle Ages and ending with post-WWII avant-garde poetry.   CL: 2020.

name: Business Readings in Italian
description: Selected literature from the Italian business world, such as correspondence, brochures, specialized newspapers and magazines, biographies of businessmen, prospectuses, and annual reports.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Conversation and Composition
description: Prepares students for making lengthy formal reports in Italian, both written and oral, on topics of importance for success within an Italian environment.   CL: 2020.

name: Italian Literature in Translation
description: Italian writers, focusing on the works of Dante, Petrarch, and Boccaccio, with additional selections from later authors.

name: Post-World War II Italian Cinema
description: Italian films of high esthetic value that present major cultural concerns of post-WWII Italians. Skills in film criticism and analysis. Films are subtitled. Taught in English.

name: Senior Project
description: Directed independent research project, with a formal presentation and public discussion.   CL: 2020.

name: Machiavelli and Renaissance Florence
description: Italian political and literary history course focusing on Machiavelli€s major publications and their meanings with regard to the cultural and political goals of the Renaissance in Italy.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Cercasi Umore: Understanding Italy
description: Comparative Italian/American literature and culture course examining the differences between humoristic texts in Italian and American cultures.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: The Italian Novella
description: Italian literature seminar tracing the history of the short story from its Italian origins through the twentieth century.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Independent Studies in Italian Literature
description: Special topics in Italian literature.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Studies in Italian Literature
description: Special topics in Italian literature.   CL: 2020.

name: Thriving in the Tech Age
description: Pervasive impact of computers on today's global society; skills and strategies for using technology.  How information technologies impact daily life and drive change.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Advanced Business Document Preparation
description: Emphasis on production and versatility in preparing business documents. Not for TSTM majors. For business teacher certification.   CL: 2020.

name: Program Design and Development
description: Fundamental algorithms and processes used in business information systems. Development and representation of programming logic. Introduction to implementation using a high-level programming language.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Computer Hardware and Software
description: Understanding of current computer hardware and software through computer building, repairing, and troubleshooting.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Business Communications
description: Theory and processes in written business communications; composing effective business letters and reports.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Word Processing Concepts and Technology
description: Introduction to word processing concepts and applications.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Networking
description: Understanding the essential concepts of computer networks, including standards, topologies, security, media, switching, routing, and more.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Computer Applications in Business I
description: Survey of core skills and techniques for spreadsheet design and analysis of business problems.   FS: 11/1/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Databases
description: Fundamentals of modern database design and applications.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Records Control
description: Analysis and control of office records including creation, processing, maintenance, protection, and disposition.   CL: 2020.

name: Cybersecurity Operations
description: Operations in Security Operations Centers (SOC). Securing information systems by monitoring, analyzing, detecting, and responding to security events.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Professional Internship Seminar
description: Preparation for professional internship.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Software Design
description: Survey of core software development principles, application development from pseudocode and flow charting through coding process.    FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Web Systems
description: Introduction to web based systems, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript; working with Content Management systems (Wordpress, Joomla); Accessibility, SEO, and web development best practices.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Database Systems in Information Technology
description: Survey of techniques for working with enterprise-level database systems.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be taken twice for credit.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction
description: Human computer interaction:  human factors of interactive software, methods to develop and assess interfaces, interaction styles, and design considerations.   FS:  12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Networking
description: Advanced administration of client/server networks with major emphasis on network operating system software.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Management of Information Technology
description: Overview of current practices and trends in end-user technology and information system management.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Mainframe Systems
description: Introduction to the large scale computer systems used by businesses to support thousands of simultaneous users and process millions of transactions.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Job Control Language
description: Programming in job control language used to process batch jobs on mainframe computers.  Use of standard system utility programs.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in information technology. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. Satisfies IIT elective requirement. May be taken three times for credit.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Information Technology Security for Managers
description: Information technology security from a managerial perspective, including security awareness, risk assessment, and security policy development.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Professional Internship
description: Internship coordinated by a faculty member and supervised by an approved business supervisor. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 11/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Emerging Information Technology Trends
description: Survey of emerging information technology (IT) trends, featuring IT industry professionals presenting disruptive and emerging information technologies being developed and/or adopted by businesses within South Carolina.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Advanced Human Computer Interaction
description: Review of current trends & challenges of human-computer interaction, the design of emerging technologies including AI-driven technologies, such as chatbot design, Internet of Things design, and human-robot interaction design, biometric evaluation methods, and usability testing with AI-driven emerging technologies.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Training Systems
description: Theory, design, and implementation of technology-based training systems, including hardware and software solutions.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Telecommunications
description: Telecommunications systems, applications, and equipment allowing for the global dissemination of information.    FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Linux Programming and Administration
description: Shell scripting and administration in the Linux operating system.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Project Management Methods
description: Project management principles and standard practices, including software applications for project management.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Web Support Systems
description: The development of advanced, dynamic, Web-based information systems, including the integration of back-end database-records management systems.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone Project for Information Technology
description: Application of project management software, technologies, and practices to the design and implementation of real-world capstone projects.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Database Management and Administration
description: Introduction to database administration and implementation using an enterprise-level Relational Database Management System (RDBMS).   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Integrated Information Technology
description: Advanced concepts, issues, and trends in technology support and training management. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. May be repeated twice for credit.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Management of Health Information Systems
description: Overview of health information technology, electronic health records (EHR) , and health information exchange (HIE), current practices, trends, and issues in health information systems management, and privacy and security of health information.

name: Elementary Japanese
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language.   CL: 2020.

name: Basic Proficiency in Japanese
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills. Admission only by successful completion of Japanese 121.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Japanese I
description: Review and continuation of fundamentals of the language; development of oral and reading skills.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Intermediate Japanese II
description: Review and continuation of fundamentals of the language; development of written and oral expression.   CL: 2020.

name: Reading and Writing Japanese
description: Acquisition and advancement of kanji literacy and writing skills. Development of foundational skills to review basic kanji and to aid in inferring the meaning of higher level kanji. Covers 250 kanji characters with complementary instruction through many mediums (brush writing, postcards, meishi).    FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Japanese Culture
description: Introduction to Japanese culture through an examination of cultural elements such as traditions, arts, history, geography, people, society, and religion. Taught in English.

name: Advanced Japanese I
description: Improvement of skills in conversation and composition; advanced reading in modern Japanese materials.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Advanced Japanese II
description: Continuation of JAPA 321, with emphasis on strengthening proficiency in the use of Kanji.   CL: 2020.

name: Japanese for Business I
description: Development of language skills specific to the Japanese business world and its practices.   CL: 2020.

name: Japanese for Business II
description: This is a continuation of JAPA 331.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Japanese Culture and Literature
description: Introduction to Japanese literature and its cultural background.  Conducted in English, but some background of Japanese is recommended.

name: Modern Japanese Literature
description: Survey of modern Japanese literature and its cultural background up to the present. Conducted in English, but some knowledge of Japanese is required.   CL: 2020.

name: Japanese Culture and Society through Film
description: Examination of Japanese culture and contemporary society using selected films. Taught in English.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Japanese Culture and Society through Theatre
description: Introduction to Japanese traditional theater and its influences on Japanese culture and society. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

name: Japanese Culture and Society through Animation
description: Examination of Japanese culture and contemporary society through studying of popular animations. Taught in English.

name: Selected Topics
description: Intensive study of selected topics in Japanese literature and culture. May be repeated for credit as topic varies by title. Taught in English.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

name: Advanced Japanese III
description: Development of proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing through advanced studies of authentic Japanese materials.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Japanese IV
description: Strengthening proficiency in writing and reading.   CL: 2020.

name: Japanese Language in Society
description: Japanese language and communication in its socio-cultural context; emphasis on comparison with American English. Taught in English.

name: Media and Society
description: Principles, history, philosophies, theories of the mass media and allied professions and their societal role and impact.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Principles of Public Relations
description: Methods used by business, government, consumer groups, minorities, environmentalists, and others to influence public attitudes toward their activities.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Principles of Advertising and Brand Communications
description: An introduction to the advertising and strategic communications industries.  Discussion of the structure and history of the business, social impacts and regulation, research, planning, creative, media planning, sales promotion, event promotion and the integrated nature of all promotional communication.

name: Principles of Visual Communications
description: Theory and history of visual communication in the mass media emphasizing informational and persuasive messages created by graphic, photographic, and multimedia processes.   FS: 4/12/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Principles of Journalism
description: Principles and foundations of journalism to reflect both how journalism serves communities and how its techniques are developed to effectively communicate to audiences.   FS: 03/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: History and Philosophy of the Mass Media
description: Development of the mass media in the United States from colonial times to the present. The effects of American social, cultural, political, and economic theory on the media.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Mass Communications
description: Readings, critical review, discussion and analysis addressing significant issues in mass communications. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different course topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Account Planning: Mining Insights
description: Topics include data mining from secondary sources, and use of primary research tools such as surveys, focus groups, ethnography and projective techniques.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Jobs in the Sports Media
description: Exploring different jobs in sports media with a focus on careers within the fields covered by the degree programs within the School of Journalism and Mass Communications.   FS: 06/07/2023.

name: Sports Activism and Media
description: Analysis of prominent sports activism cases and exploration of issues of access, economics, race, religion, gender, culture and nationality, through the lens of media coverage.   FS: 11/03/2021.

name: Special Topics in Sports Media
description: Topics addressing issues in the world of the sports media. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Live Television Sports Production
description: This course is designed to introduce students to all aspects of live television production of various venue sporting events. Through readings, lectures and hands-on experience, students will learn how major broadcast networks produce live sports events.   FS: 09/09/2020.

name: Journalism Trends
description: Study and analysis of current and emerging issues in journalism philosophy and practice and how audiences perceive it. Emphases may change as practices evolve and issues emerge.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Social Media and Society
description: Analysis of major social media sites and the role they play in informative and persuasive communications.  Review of key platforms, what makes them successful as well as concerns about their impact and misuse.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Writing for Mass Communications
description: Basic writing skills for all areas of the mass media. Lecture-laboratory.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Law and Ethics of Mass Communications
description: Examination of First Amendment free speech and press guarantees and limitations, including commercial speech regulation, libel, privacy, copyright, trademark and open records and meetings, and related ethical principles for mass communications professionals.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Internet and Social Media Law
description: Examination of the origins and history of First Amendment and related law and ethics, with an emphasis on how they apply to the Internet and social media.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Theories of Mass Communications
description: Survey of predominant theories in mass communications including mass media uses, functions, and effects.

name: Media, Sports and Race
description: Exploration of the intersection of American media, sports and race.   FS: 12/01/201.

name: Media and Youth
description: An introduction to media uses and effects research, considering cognitive, affective, and social development as a framework for analyzing media effects on youth.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Hip Hop, Media and Society
description: Hip-hop culture as a contemporary youth subculture, a historically African American aesthetic, a vehicle for mainstream media products and its impact on the innovation economy.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Minorities, Women, and the Mass Media
description: The study of the relationship among persons of color, women, and the mass media in the United States.    FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Toolkit for Concept Development
description: Students will learn the theories and methods of applying consumer and brand insights to creative briefs and concepts.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Toolkit for Brand Communication: Creative Execution
description: Use of art direction and copywriting to create advertising and brand communication across a variety of media types using industry relevant software.   FS: 02/01/2023.

name: A Focused Look at Brand Communications
description: Topics in advertising and strategic communications. Individual topics and prerequisites to be announced with title.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Advertising and Brand Communications Speakers Series
description: Advertising and brand communications industry experts share insights about industry trends, innovative campaigns and careers.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Social Media Marketing Strategy
description: Instruction on how to align social media with business objectives and overall communication strategies; and exploration of how organizations have incorporated social media into various departmental functions.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Mass Communications Research
description: Fundamentals of mass communications research methods and applications. Survey, observational and experimental research; primary research data-gathering techniques; secondary research sources; data analysis; message, market, competitive and audience research measures.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Relations for Nonprofit Organizations
description: Theory and practice of developing public relations strategies and messaging for nonprofit organizations with a focus on audience research, donor relations, membership recruitment and fund raising.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Special Topics in Public Relations
description: Special topics course addressing current issues, problems, and/or trends in public relations. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different course topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Social Media for Sports Media
description: Effective social media use in the world of the sports media. Topics relating to advertising, journalism, public relations, visual communications, and mass communications will be discussed. Provides contextual background on various social media and uses exercises to develop best practices.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: SEC Football and Sports Media
description: The media€s role in how the public views the SEC football games, schools, and athletes is a key component to the mystique of the league. This course examines the media€s role in the past, present, and future of the SEC.   FS: 06/07/2023.

name: Gender, Sexuality, and Sports Media
description: How the sports media culture helps create and maintain, as well as challenge, inequalities based on gender and sexual identity. Students will learn how gender and sexuality are constructed through sports media and how they intersect with race, class, able-bodiedness and nationality.   FS: 11/04/2020.

name: Graphics for Visual Communications
description: The personal computer and software related to the design and production of graphic and photographic images for print and onscreen media.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Photography for Visual Communications
description: Introductory photography that includes digital SLR camera use, multiple lenses, lighting, editing and distribution for web and display. Emphasis is on storytelling images for publication in editorial and persuasive media.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Creative Thinking and Problem Solving
description: This course introduces the fundamental principles of creative behavior. Theoretical and practical methods of problem-solving as well as discovery, evaluation, and implementation of new ideas.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Introductory Reporting and Writing
description: Basics of news reporting: Story generation, critical thinking, story development, writing, shooting and editing broadcast stories, writing Web stories, using visual components of still pictures, graphics and video.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Introductory Reporting and Writing Lab
description: Basics of news reporting: Story generation, critical thinking, story development, writing, shooting and editing broadcast stories, writing Web stories, using visual components of still pictures, graphics and video.   FS: 10/04/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Editing
description: Skills and techniques required in preparing stories for publication. Laboratory work includes editing various kinds of copy and writing headlines.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Social Media and Mobile Journalism
description: This course provides an introduction on how to use online social platforms and mobile tools following journalistic editorial guidelines. Students will get an overview of the digital-first mindset that informs and enriches their professional preparation.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Business Basics for Communications
description: Students will gain a fundamental understanding of business and how write about it. Students will learn how various aspects of business, finance and the economy relate to individuals, communities, companies, governments and world events and how to communicate that impact.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Professional Perspectives in Business Communications
description: These classes focus on specific areas of business communications to either deepen students€ understanding of the subject or improve their ability with a particular skill (reporting, writing, editing, videography, social media, etc.). These topics may change from term to term.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Social Media Planning
description: An introduction to social media planning and digital media analytic skills, includes survey and analysis of content and strategies based on social media insights.   FS: 02/03/2021.

name: Sports Media and Society
description: History of sports media and an analysis of current relationships between the sports industry, athletes, media, social media and the audience.    FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Podcasting and Audio Production
description: This course is designed to teach you the fundamentals of audio storytelling, from conception and field gathering skills to writing for the ear and basic non-linear audio production. You will learn to distinguish the ways audio stories differ from those in print, and produce different types of media projects.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Digital Signage
description: This class is introduces you to what is rapidly becoming the "fifth screen" digital signage, its place in modern communications, some of the issues surrounding it and how to create and evaluate content for it. Students will evaluate the SJMC digital sign system and may create content for it.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Sports Media Ethics
description: Examination of the ethical dilemmas and moral situations that sports media members face from outside and internal sources and the ethical obligation to provide citizens with fair and balanced reporting of issues.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Research Experience In Mass Communications
description: Supervised mass communications research experience to develop student€s advanced research and analytical skills. Individual research contract developed in consultation with the instructor.   FS: 09/14/2022.

name: Diversity Topics in Mass Media
description: Topics addressing the intersection of race, gender, sexual orientation, or other forms of diversity or marginality and mass media. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics
description: Topics in journalism and mass communications. Individual topics and prerequisites to be announced.  Some topics may have prerequisites; check with student services or the syllabus for the section you are interested in.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Digital Media and Big Data Analysis
description: Understanding digital media concepts including AI, blockchain, net neutrality, big data, privacy, and network analysis.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Creative: Strategy to Execution
description: Principles and practices of developing creative and effective brand communications and to acquire proficiency in execution of brand communications.    FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Special Topics in Advertising
description: Topics addressing contemporary issues in advertising and brand communications. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 09/09/2020.

name: Media Analysis
description: Research and development of a media plan using integrated communications approach and simulation models.     FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Super Bowl Commercials
description: An exploration of how Super Bowl commercials reflect and influence our society. Topics include the way different groups are portrayed, the strategy behind the commercials, and how creative tactics have evolved.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Relations Writing
description: Special areas of writing for public relations.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Public Relations Writing
description: An applied writing skills laboratory that will review and create advanced types of public relations writing and study applicable theory, models and research methods.    FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Media Relations
description: Planning and writing skills to effectively execute media relations, including how to research reporters and outlets, build a media relations plan, create messaging platforms, identify and prepare spokespeople, manage crisis communications and employ social media.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Leadership and Internal Relations Management
description: Leadership and communication inside an organization as a component of public relations management; strategy, change management, ethics, employees from executive to labor, and organizational theory applied to engage internal stakeholders.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Sports Announcing
description: This course is designed to introduce students to various aspects of live sports broadcasting. Students will learn skills and techniques that will prepare them to perform live on-air duties including game play-by-play and color analyst.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Multimedia Sports Storytelling
description: Crafting longform sports media stories through course-long projects and in-class exercises that sharpen storytelling skills and techniques.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Team Media for Sports Media
description: The emerging field of sports team media. Content will expose students to many topic areas that comprise team media including sports advertising, journalism, public relations, visual communications, and content creation.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Informational Graphics
description: Visual presentation of quantitative and spatial information.  Examines the planning, design, and preparation of statistical graphs, charts, timelines, diagrams, and maps.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Video for Visual Communications
description: Theory, skills, and techniques to create high-quality videos and multimedia for use in a variety of media applications, including editorial assignments, informational messages and persuasive communications. Emphasis on one-person producer with minimal equipment telling stories for non-traditional media.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Multimedia for Visual Communications
description: Team-based multimedia storytelling with an emphasis on studio and location lighting to produce professional-level photography projects and short videos for use in a variety of applications, including editorial assignments and persuasive communications.   FS: 02/03/2021.

name: Design of Online Content
description: Introduction to the skills and processes involved in the design and display of online content such as interactive graphics, animation, and video. Considerations for designing and delivering content on a variety of platforms from personal computers to mobile devices.    FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Studio and Location Lighting for Still Photography
description: Still photography lighting techniques for mass media applications. Emphasis on studio and on-location lighting of portraits, fashion, illustrations, food and product photography.   FS: 04/06/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Freelancing for Creative Professionals
description: The theory and practice of entrepreneurship as they apply to creative professionals interested in starting their own freelance business.   FS: 4/5/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Photojournalism
description: Immersive course in long-form photojournalism storytelling. Students will spend the semester documenting a topic, with emphasis on gathering images with high technical level and compelling content. Class will edit content and create a presentation for the public compelling content.

name: Special Topics in Visual Communications
description: Introduction to issues surrounding the history, theory, skills and techniques of developing and niche visual communications technologies, topics, skills and concepts. Topics may change from term to term. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 11/04/2020.

name: Sports Journalism
description: This course introduces students to the core principles, values, and best practices that guide the work of professional sports journalists. Students will develop skills that are necessary to function as sports journalists in today€s media environment.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Intermediate Reporting and Production
description: Continuing development of students€ ability to identify, gather, write, edit and present news, responsibly and ethically, across a range of formats, alone and in teams.   FS: 03/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Power Producing
description: Examines the art and skill of television news producing, providing students the opportunity to learn about the production process in a real-world, hands-on environment.   FS: 02/03/2021.

name: Special Topics in Nonfiction Storytelling with Emerging Technologies
description: Students produce in-depth journalism projects using a range of storytelling tools and technologies, such as: websites, interactive graphics/maps, HD- and 360-video, drones, AR/VR technology, and podcasting. May be repeated for credit with different topics.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Media Management
description: This course provides an introduction to and overview of issues and practices in media management. You will steep yourself in and become conversant about economic, industrial and societal forces that influence modern media content curation, production and distribution.   FS: 09/09/2020.

name: Business Reporting and Writing
description: This course is designed to build on your basic knowledge of various aspects of business and give you the tools and skills you need to synthesize sometimes complex information and communicate it clearly and accurately to an audience.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Reporting and Writing About the Economy
description: This course is designed to build on your basic knowledge of various aspects of the economy and give you the tools and skills you need to synthesize sometimes complex information and communicate it clearly and accurately to an audience.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Communication and Information Transfer
description: An overview of the communication models, major concepts, trends, and other related issues of information transfer with a focus on information seeking and use in digital age.    FS: 4/5/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics
description: Topics in journalism and mass communications. Individual topics will vary by title.  Prerequisites to be announced in class schedule.   FS: 02/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Freedom, Responsibility, and Ethics of the Mass Media
description: Historical development of freedom, responsibility, and ethics in the mass media, including communication theories, pressures, ownership.

name: International Mass Communications
description: A comparative study of world mass communications media, with particular attention to press systems, the sources and flow of international news, and the problems and implications of world communications.   FS: 10/02/2019

name: Mass Media Criticism
description: Development of critical thinking skills for analyzing mass media.   FS: 02/05//2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Health Communication: The Science and Practice
description: Explores the role of journalism in shaping perceptions of scientific issues and task. Emphasis on methods of effectively communicating about science, health, and the environment.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Faith, Values, and the Mass Media
description: Faith and values influence the media. An examination of the influence, why it happens, and of religious diversity and the increased public presence of religions, including Hinduism and Islam.   FS: 10/02/2019

name: Environmental Communication: The Science and Practice
description: The role of journalism in shaping perceptions of environmental and scientific issues and tasks. Emphasis on methods of effectively communicating about science and the environment.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Mass Communications Capstone Portfolio
description: Development of Mass Communications E-portfolio showcasing and reflecting on coursework and experiential learning, with a focus on leadership, as preparation for matriculation in higher education or careers in mass media.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Advanced Creative
description: Development of writing styles for print and broadcast advertising.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Integrated Campaigns
description: The development of a complete, well coordinated integrated communications plan that incorporates research and analysis techniques, critical thinking, team work, creative and tactical skills.    FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Brand Communications Practicum/Competitions
description: Application of advertising techniques and skills in preparation of full scale campaign.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Interactive Communication Strategies
description: The development of a complete, well-coordinated integrated communications plan that incorporates research and analysis techniques, critical thinking, team work, creative and tactical skills.   FS:12/01/2021.

name: Advertising Management
description: The dynamics of leadership and management in the creative industries.    FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Creative Leadership
description: Theories of leadership as applied to creative industries. Students will engage and interact with community-based organizations to assess needs, plan communications strategies, lead student teams in developing those ideas, and present to clients. Junior standing or permission of instructor.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Relations Campaigns
description: Development of public relations campaigns for business and social institutions. Case studies of public relations campaigns and programs.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Relations Management
description: Researching, programming, staff, budgeting, and planning public-relations programs by business, government, or consulting firms.   FS: 03/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Publication Writing and Design
description: Publication writing and design as well as internal or constituent communications, specifically focused on an internal audience. Production of InterCom, the College of Mass Communications and Information Studies€ alumni magazine.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Crisis Communications
description: Introduction to crisis communications and management from a strategic, theory-based approach using research from historical and current case studies.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: The Carolina Agency
description: Participation in a functioning communications agency working for actual clients in a student-directed environment. Opportunity to both lead and be a part of a team servicing the communication needs of various clients.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: The Bateman Team
description: Self-directed development and implementation of a public relations campaign as part of a national competition: PRSSA€s Bateman Competition.    FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Ethics in Public Relations and Public Policy
description: Review of the analytical process of resolving complex ethical issues and cases in public relations; study of the philosophical approaches to communication ethics.    FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Opinion and Persuasion
description: Theory and practice of persuasive communication and the role of persuasion in shaping public opinion.

name: Advanced Magazine Article Writing
description: Writing techniques used in the preparation and marketing of major nonfiction articles for national, regional, and local publications.   CL: 2020.

name: Motion-Based Graphics for Visual Communications
description: Graphic and motion-based principles and techniques for visual communications within multimedia structures.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Capstone Portfolio Development
description: Advanced techniques of graphic and multimedia design and their application to problem-solving situations in the mass media. Emphasis on portfolio development.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Public/Civic Journalism
description: To gain an understanding of theory and practice of public/civic journalism, seen by its advocates as socially responsible journalism that attempts to build civic participation and empower communities.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Magazine Article Writing
description: Researching, organizing, writing, and marketing articles for publication in general and specialized publications.   FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Editorial and Opinion Writing
description: Content and style; writing of editorials, analyses, and commentaries.   FS: 06/07/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Data Journalism
description: Acquiring, analyzing and presenting data using spreadsheets and other tools to uncover stories and provide depth and context to journalism.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Broadcast Journalism Practicum
description: Production of public affairs programs.    CL: 2020.

name: Reporting Public Affairs
description: Concentrated analyses of reporting in special fields, particularly in the South, including coverage of government, business, labor, the arts and sciences.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Broadcast Announcing
description: Theory and practice of professional broadcast announcing. Lecture-demonstration-laboratory course in principles underlying professional performance before microphones and cameras and the various broadcast performance functions.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Reporting Topics
description: Study and application of highly specialized reporting on topics related to current public discourse. May be repeated as content varies by title.    FS: 12/4/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone I - Advanced Reporting - Broadcast and Online Journalism
description: Professional practice in meeting daily newscast deadlines through work on the Carolina News television newscast. Focus on polished reporting, performance and production techniques and demonstration of advanced television reporting skills under deadline pressure.    FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone I - Advanced Reporting - Multimedia Journalism
description: Professional practice in shaping journalistic reporting to the multimedia environment.  Application of news gathering, synthesizing and reporting across platforms €“ print and online, textual and graphic €“ in timely fashion.    FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone II - Advanced Broadcast and Online Journalism Production
description: Advanced newscast production skills developed in the context of producing daily Carolina News broadcast. Shape and coordinate reporting and production team under deadline pressure in newsroom setting.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone II - Advanced Multimedia Journalism Production
description: Editing and design employed to maximize effectiveness in the multimedia environment. Creating accurate and engaging content to reach consumers in varied ways reflecting contemporary consumer use of media.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Capstone III - Digital Journalism
description: Exposure to the evolving variety of journalism techniques, software programs and equipment to effectively tell compelling stories and convey information in multiple visual and interactive forms. Emphasis on extending professional skills while reinforcing current best practices.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: The Carolina Agency Management Training
description: Advanced instruction on how to assume leadership roles in a real life agency setting through tactical planning updates, interdepartmental management, budgeting, and client reviews.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Domestic Study Away in Journalism and Mass Communications
description: Domestic study away course will focus on topics in journalism and mass communications and will be taught away from the University of South Carolina Columbia campus. Individual topics will vary by title. Prerequisites to be announced in class schedule.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Study Abroad in Journalism and Mass Communications
description: Study abroad course will focus on topics in journalism and mass communications and will be taught as a study abroad experience. Individual topics will vary by title. Prerequisites to be announced in class schedule.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Internship in Mass Communications
description: Supervised professional experience. Maximum of three hours credit. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required.    CL: 2020.

name: Directed Independent Studies
description: Individual mass media projects. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Special Topics
description: Advanced topics in journalism and mass communications.  Individual topics and prerequisites to be announced by title in class schedule.   CL: 2020.

name: Convergence and Divergence in African American and Jewish Relations: Historical and Contemporary
description: An examination of African American and Jewish American inter-ethnic, historical and contemporary connections and disconnections. Implications for educational, social, and social settings are considered.   FS: 04/15/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Judaism
description: Overview of Jewish experiences, beliefs, practices from a contextual point of view.   FS: 06/07/2017.

name: Language and Humor at the Intersections of Religion, Race, Ethnicity, and Gender
description: Explores language and humor, looking at (i) the linguistic structure and psychology of humor, (ii) changing societal standards for humor, (iii) racial, ethnic, religious, and gender-based humor, and (iv) socio-political questions surrounding the use of these. FS: 09/14/2022.

name: Hebrew Bible (Old Testament)
description: Modern study of the Hebrew Bible from historical, literary, and archeological points of view.  Reading and analysis of texts in translation.   FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Literature and Film of the Holocaust
description: Film, poetry and literature created in response to the Holocaust as the means for a decades long cultural discussion, in European and American societies, of the moral and religious implications of the Holocaust on our self-understandings as religious and moral beings.   FS: 10/06/2021.

name: Jewish History I: Late Antiquity to 1500
description: The religious, cultural, social, and political conditions that shaped the Jewish experience in the Near East and Europe from Late Antiquity to 1500.

name: Jewish History II: 1500 to the Present
description: Case studies of Jewish history in Europe, America, and the land of Israel, 1500 to the present.

name: Jews and Muslims
description: Jewish-Muslim relations in the Near East and the US; an exploration of Jewish-Muslim encounters, issues of religious law, politics, radical religious ideologies, and their repercussions for today.   CL: 2020.

name: Kabbalah: Science, Religion and Nature in Western History
description: Historical investigation of kabbalah, a philosophical system and mystical current common to Judaism, Islam, and Christianity, from the medieval period to the present; focus on its formative role in early modern Western cosmology and science, and its ecological implications today.     FS: 11/04/2020.

name: American Jewish History
description: Examination of experiences of Jews in the United States from Colonial Period to late 20th century, especially Jewish immigration, political behavior, social mobility, religious affiliation, group identity formation, and meaning of Anti-Semitism in American and global contexts.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Visions of Apocalypse
description: Symbolic visions, tours of heaven and hell, cosmic battles, divine judgment, messianic figures, prophecy, or other forms of revelation as found in literature, art, or social movements from diverse geographical and historical locations.    FS: 11/2/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Jewish Studies
description: Intensive study of special topics in Jewish Studies; may emphasize interdisciplinary themes. Maybe be repeated as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

name: History of the Holocaust
description: Introduction to Nazi Germany€s systematic mass-murder of Europe€s Jews and other minorities during war. Examination of forces that led to the Holocaust, including scientific racism, Nazi policy implementation, and dynamics of annihilation during war.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Elementary Korean
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language.

name: Basic Proficiency in Korean
description: Practice and development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Korean I
description: Review and continuation of fundamentals of the language; development of oral and reading skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Korean II
description: Increased emphasis on written and oral expression in Korean.   CL: 2020.

name: Nursing Care Management IV
description: This course focuses on the delivery of nursing care to clients throughout the lifespan who are experiencing complex, multi-system health problems.

name: Latin American, Caribbean, and Latino/a Cultures through Film
description: Interdisciplinary introduction to the diversity of landscapes and political and social issues in Latin America€s history. Films, lectures, and readings provide an overall comprehensive perspective. Lectures by faculty in Spanish, Portuguese, anthropology, and history.   CL: 2020.

name: Interdisciplinary Study of Latin America
description: Anthropology, geography, history, politics, language, and culture of Latin America.

name: Working with Hispanic Clients
description: Crosscultural approaches to interactions with persons of Hispanic origin in a variety of professional settings. Readings, speakers, media. Taught in Spanish. Departmental permission required for transfer students.   CL: 2020.

name: Latin American Cultures
description: Comparative study of selected Latin American cultures with emphasis on their significance for a broader anthropological theory.

name: South American Indian Cultures
description: An examination of ethnographic data on South American Indians, emphasizing methods used to acquire those data and their applications to theoretical considerations.

name: Mesoamerican Prehistory
description: Cultural development and variation in Mesoamerica from the first arrival of man to the arrival of Europeans. Particular attention to cultural continuities from prehistoric times.

name: Prehistoric Civilizations of the New World
description: Study of Mesoamerican and South American civilizations, particularly the Mayan, Aztec, and Inca states. Processes of state formation as reflected in archaeological data.

name: Geography of Latin America
description: Physical and human geography of Latin America.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Colonial Latin America
description: The establishment and consolidation of the Spanish and Portuguese empires in the Western hemisphere; interaction of Indians, Africans, and Iberians, and the formation of social, economic, and political traditions in Latin America; political independence.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Modern Latin America
description: Traditional society in the area and problems arising from social, economic, and political changes since independence; comparative studies of national responses to these problems.   CL: 2020.

name: Politics and Governments of Latin America
description: The development, principles, political thought, and politics of the several Latin American states.

name: Spanish American Civilization
description: Lectures, readings, and visuals on selected topics of Spanish American civilization and its cultural heritage.   CL: 2020.

name: Literary Tendencies and Masterpieces of Spanish America
description: A survey of the masterworks and literary tendencies of Spanish America.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Latin American Studies
description: Selected Topics on Latin America. May be repeated for credit as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Prehistoric Archaeology of South America
description: Prehistoric archaeology of the South American continent.

name: Social and Economic History of Latin America
description: The evolution of social groups and changes in economic patterns in Latin America from pre-Columbian times to the present.   CL: 2020.

name: History of Mexico
description: Mexico from the pre-conquest period to the present, with an emphasis on modern Mexico.   CL: 2020.

name: International Relations of Latin America
description: Contemporary international relations among Latin American states, including economic and political security and relations with the United States.   CL: 2020.

name: Contemporary Spanish-American Literature
description: Survey of the most significant work from 1960 to the present.   CL: 2020.

name: Senior Seminar
description: Study in depth of a topic on Latin America.

name: Contemporary Latin America
description: Analysis and discussion of contemporary Latin American history and the sociocultural forces that have contributed to define this area's national identities. Taught in Spanish.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Colonial Spanish-American Literature to Neoclassicism
description: Survey or pre-Columbian poetry and of texts dating from the time of Columbus to the end of the Colonial period.   CL: 2020.

name: Beginning Latin I
description: Introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental reading skills. Admission to 109 restricted to those who have never studied Latin, who have not studied Latin in the previous five years, or who have a score of L-1 on the placement test.   CL: 2020.

name: Beginning Latin II
description: Introduction to grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental reading skills. Credit may not be received for both LATN 109/LATN 110 and LATN 121.   CL: 2020.

name: Elementary Latin
description: Grammar and vocabulary necessary for fundamental reading skills. Assumes prior experience in Latin. Admission only by proficiency examination. Credit may be received for only one of the following: LATN 109/LATN 110 or LATN 121.   CL: 2020.

name: Basic Proficiency in Latin
description: Practice and further development of essential reading skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Readings in Latin Literature
description: A survey of Latin literature designed for the student who wishes to develop a major or cognate in Latin.   CL: 2020.

name: Virgil
description: Readings from the Aeneid.

name: Latin Literature of the Golden Age
description: Selected readings in prose and poetry of representative authors.

name: Latin Composition
description: A study of Latin syntax in order to translate English prose into Latin. Instruction is individualized.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

name: Latin Drama
description: Selected plays of Plautus and Terence.

name: Cicero
description: Readings from a variety of Cicero€s works to gain a concept of the man as a humanist.

name: Horace
description: Readings from the Odes.

name: Ovid
description: Selected readings from the Metamorphoses.

name: Tacitus
description: Agricola or selections from the Annales.

name: Livy
description: Readings from Ab Urbe Condita.

name: Roman Satire
description: Readings in Horace, Juvenal, and Petronius.

name: Latin Erotic Poetry
description: Readings from the elegies of Catullus, Tibullus, Propertius, and Ovid.

name: Lucretius
description: Readings from the De Rerum Natura.

name: Renaissance Latin
description: An examination of several genres of Latin writing from Europe during the period 1400-1600, emphasizing, but not limited to, Italian writers.   CL: 2020.

name: History of Latin Literature from the Origins to the Golden Age
description: Readings from the Twelve Tables to Virgil, supplemented by readings in history and scholarship. Designed to prepare majors and honors students for further study.

name: History of Latin Literature in the Silver Age
description: Readings from Ovid to Ammianus, supplemented by readings in history and scholarship. Designed to prepare majors and honors students for further study.

name: Independent Study
description: Special projects for independent study and research.

name: Independent Study
description: Special projects for independent study and research.

name: Teaching Advanced Latin in Secondary School
description: Methods and materials for teaching the Latin Advanced Placement courses in secondary school.

name: Information Literacy
description: Introduction to methods and ethics of information research, with emphasis on analyzing and defining information needs and resources, creating and refining search strategies, evaluating resources, and synthesizing and citing information. Admission restricted to undergraduates.   CL: 2020.

name: Linguistics 1: Introduction to Language
description: Introduction to the human capacity for language and to how it is acquired. Investigation of language varieties, dialects, and styles. Examination of the social and geographical factors that contribute to language variation and change.   FS 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Integrated Linguistic Skills for Non-Native Speakers 1
description: Linguistic skills for low-advanced non-native speakers of English related to writing, grammar, reading, listening and speaking for academic purposes.   Students enrolled in the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Integrated Linguistic Skills for Non-Native Speakers 2
description: Linguistic skills for low-advanced non-native speakers of English related to writing, grammar, reading, listening and speaking for academic purposes with a focus on research skills. Students enrolled in the International Accelerator Program.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Integrated Linguistic Skills for Non-Native Speakers 3
description: Linguistic skills for advanced non-native speakers English related to writing, grammar, reading, listening and speaking for academic purposes with a focus on productive skills.  Students enrolled in the International Accelerator Program.    FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Linguistics I
description: Topics of a broad nature that require no previous study in linguistics. May be repeated as content varies by title.    CL: 2020.

name: Linguistic Diversity Awareness
description: A course designed to cultivate awareness of phonological and grammatical differences among dialects of English and ability to switch comfortably between one€s dialect and standard usage. Two-hour lecture and laboratory.

name: Special Topics in Linguistics II
description: Topics of a more focused nature that require no previous study in linguistics. May be repeated as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Language Conflict and Language Rights
description: Examination of linguistic conflict and rights, as well as centrality of language rights to human rights and personal/cultural identity.  Basic facts about language related to identity, culture, attitudes, dialects, bilingualism.  Case studies (local, national, international) with particular attention to nationalism, language revitalization, language planning.   FS: 04/04/2018.

name: Language and Popular Culture
description: Linguistic anthropological study of forms of language through the lens of popular culture. Explore the ethnography of communication through play and performance, discursive and semiotic practices, and varieties of language invoked in popular cultural forms that provide resources for cultural reproduction and contestation.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Language and Humor at the Intersections of Religion, Race, Ethnicity, and Gender
description: Explores language and humor, looking at (i) the linguistic structure and psychology of humor, (ii) changing societal standards for humor, (iii) racial, ethnic, religious, and gender-based humor, and (iv) socio-political questions surrounding the use of these.    FS: 09/14/2022.

name: Korean Popular Culture and Language
description: Introduction to linguistic and anthropological concepts through the lens of South Korean popular culture.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Cross-Cultural Communication
description: This course introduces students to the fields of interactional sociolinguistics and linguistic anthropology. Students will learn how they approach the study of cross-cultural and intercultural forms of (mis)communication within the context of globally interconnected people, places, and systems of communication.   FS: 06/03/2020.

name: Introduction to Language Sciences
description: Introduction to the linguistic component of human cognition. Properties of speech, the organization of language in the mind/brain, cross-linguistic universals, child language acquisition, and aspects of adult language processing.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: The English Language
description: Introduction to the field of linguistics with an emphasis on English. Covers the English sound system, word structure, and grammar. Explores history of English, American dialects, social registers, and style.   FS: 11/7/2018.

name: Chinese Language and Society
description: A comprehensive and up-to-date survey of Chinese language in a social context, teaching students not only the linguistic structure of modern standard Chinese but also how language and society mutually influence each other in history and today€s digital age. Hands-on instruction to carry out linguistic research.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Linguistics III
description: Reading and research on selected topics in linguistics that may require previous study in linguistics or a related field. Prerequisites listed for each course offering. May be repeated as content varies by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Spanish Phonetics and Pronunciation
description: Analysis of and practice in pronunciation, listening comprehension, and dialect recognition based on study of the speech sounds, combinations, patterns, and processes of Spanish phonetics and phonology. Department permission required for transfer students.   CL: 2020.

name: French Phonetics
description: Analysis of and practice in pronunciation and listening comprehension.    FS: 09/09/2020.

name: Language, Culture, and Society
description: Language in its social setting. The relationship between linguistic categories and culture categories. Language and cognition.   CL: 2020.

name: Language in the USA
description: Linguistic examination of the structure, history, and use of language varieties in the U.S., with a particular focus on regional and sociocultural variation and relevant sociolinguistic issues.   FS: 11/7/2018

name: Teaching English Abroad
description: An intensive, hands-on introduction to principles and techniques of teaching English language learners, exposing students to norms of the field of Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL), working with non-native English speakers, and discovering TESOL opportunities worldwide.   FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and program director is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Topics in Linguistics
description: Intensive study of selected topics; may emphasize interdisciplinary themes.

name: English Grammar
description: Major structures of English morphology and syntax; role of language history and social and regional variation in understanding contemporary English.   FS: 11/7/2018.

name: Development of the English Language
description: History of English from the earliest Old English texts through Middle English to Contemporary English. No previous knowledge of Old or Middle English is required.   FS: 11/7/2018.

name: Language in Society
description: Patterns in language use as a reflection of social group memberships or the negotiation of interpersonal relationships; special attention to social dialects and stylistic difference in American English.   FS: 11/7/2018.

name: African-American English
description: Linguistic examination of the structure, history, and use of African-American English, as well as literary presentations, language attitudes, and issues relating to education and the acquisition of Standard English.

name: Introduction to Technology in Language Education
description: Acquaints students with principles and practices concerning the use of technology in foreign language teaching. Explores connections between second language acquisition and the implementation of Internet and multimedia technologies.   FS: 11/7/2018.

name: Cognitive and Social Aspects of Bilingualism
description: Bilingual language development, social and cultural aspects of bilingualism, the bilingual brain, bilingualism throughout the lifespan.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: French Linguistics
description: The structure, morphology, and syntax of modern French.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to German Linguistics
description: Structural and descriptive linguistics applied to the German language.   FS: 12/05/2018.

name: Introduction to Spanish Linguistics
description: Phonology, morphology, and syntax of modern Spanish.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Interdisciplinary Topics in Linguistics
description: Topics selected by the instructor for specialized study. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes title. May be repeated with different title.   CL: 2020.

name: French Phonology
description: The sound system and its functioning in the morphological system of French from the point of view of current phonological theory.   CL: 2020.

name: Contrastive English-Spanish Phonetics and Phonology
description: Introduction to the study of phonetics and phonology and their application to the sounds and sound systems of English and Spanish. Includes transcription practice and discussion of relevance to teaching.

name: Advanced English Grammar
description: Practical survey of the syntactic structures of English; usage, social and regional variation emphasis on data.   FS: 09/09/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Mathematical Methods in Linguistics
description: Introduction to mathematical mechanisms that play a prominent role in the formalization of syntactic and semantic theories, showing how they are applied to an understanding of the working parts of human language. The topics covered include: set theory, logic, English as a formal language, and languages & grammars.   FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Language Change
description: Major ways in which phonetics, phonology, syntax, morphology, and semantics change through language history; social factors which promote innovation.

name: Introduction to the Germanic Languages
