name: Secondary Brass-French Horn
description: Secondary Brass - French Horn. Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

name: Secondary Brass-Trombone
description: Secondary Brass - Trombone.  Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

name: Secondary Brass-Tuba Euphonium
description: Secondary Brass - Tuba Euphonium.  Fundamentals of playing and teaching brass instruments in a homogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to the instrument relating to care and repair, embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, intonation, and teaching materials. One class meeting per week. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

name: Classroom Instruments
description: Class instruction in guitar, recorder, non-pitched and pitched percussion, with emphasis on the development of performance skills, the understanding of pedagogical techniques and materials, and the ability to play and teach these instruments in a group setting.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Group Piano
description: A course for beginning piano students meeting in groups. Emphasis on music reading and elementary techniques. Two meetings and two laboratory periods a week. Repeatable once for credit.

name: Group Piano
description: A course for beginning piano students meeting in groups. Emphasis on music reading and elementary techniques. Two meetings and two laboratory periods a week. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Class Voice (Basic)
description: Elementary courses in singing in which both group and individual techniques are employed. Study of voice production and principles of singing.

name: Class Voice (Basic)
description: Elementary courses in singing in which both group and individual techniques are employed. Study of voice production and principles of singing.

name: Music Education Practicum
description: Practicum experiences in various types of public school music settings. Seminars and group discussions included. Pass-Fail credit.

name: Class Voice (Intermediate)
description: Continued study of the principles of singing and song repertoire.

name: Class Voice (Intermediate)
description: Continued study of the principles of singing and song repertoire.

name: Choral Literature Lab I
description: Practical application of choral conducting skills and rehearsal techniques with choral literature.   CL: 2020.

name: Choral Literature Lab II
description: Continued application of choral conducting skills and rehearsal techniques with choral literature.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Group Piano
description: Group piano for music education students emphasizing choral music. Opportunities for accompanying instrumentalists, vocalists, and choral groups. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Advanced Group Piano
description: Group piano for music education students emphasizing choral music. Opportunities for accompanying instrumentalists, vocalists, and choral groups. Repeatable once for credit.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Wind Pedagogy I
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching wind instruments in a heterogeneous class. Study of basic principles regarding embouchure, tone production, articulation, fingering, and teaching materials.

name: Strings
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching string instruments in a heterogeneous class. Problems unique to each instrument relating to care and repair, tone production, bowing, fingering, and teaching materials.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Instrumental Techniques for Choral Majors
description: Techniques for leading an instrumental or mixed choral/instrumental ensemble. Instrumental tone, maintenance, score-reading skills, transposition, and rehearsal methods. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Percussion Techniques
description: Fundamentals of playing and teaching percussion instruments. Special study of problems unique to each percussion instrument and related teaching materials.   FS: 12/05/2018.

name: Percussion Practicum
description: Practicum experiences teaching percussion in various types of school and community music settings.

name: Music for Young Children
description: Examination and practical application of methods, techniques, and materials for teaching music, Pre-K to Grade 5.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Band Literature and Materials
description: A study of teaching materials, solo- and small-ensemble literature, and full band ensemble literature appropriate for grades 5-12.

name: Jazz/Pop Styles and Improvisation
description: A study of the essential elements in jazz and popular music. Familiarization and practice with materials and methods of teaching improvisation and jazz performance.

name: Technology for Music Teachers
description: Familiarization with computer software and hardware for the teaching of music and administration of music programs.

name: General Music in Elementary Schools
description: Discussion of sequential music development; implementation of methods, techniques, and materials for teaching music in grades K-5.   FS: 12/05/2018.

name: Practicum in Elementary Music
description: Practical application of elementary methods and techniques studied in school settings.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: General Music in Secondary Schools
description: Middle-school and high-school general music education philosophy, teaching techniques, music objectives, curriculum development, administration, facilities, and equipment.

name: Choral Methods and Materials
description: Procedures and materials for choral instruction applicable to elementary, middle-school, and high-school choruses; basic concepts of choral tone and vocal development.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Practicum in Choral Music
description: Practical application of choral methods and techniques in school settings. Not auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Marching Band Techniques
description: Fundamentals of marching, maneuvering, and formations; special features such as drum majoring and auxiliary units; discussion and planning of halftime shows.

name: Directed Teaching (Music)
description: A clinical field experience in the public school setting.     Note:  Prior to enrolling in MUED 477, students must complete the following:    1)   Admission to the Professional Program, and    2)   All MUED courses, and conducting courses are required for the student€s specific degree track.  Courses must be passed with Grade of €C€? or better. Students are strongly encouraged to complete all MUSC courses prior to the student teaching semester for optimum preparation for the pre-service internship.    No additional course work may be taken during the Directed Teaching semester without permission of the School of Music Undergraduate Director.   Restricted to seniors.    Special Permissions:  Department   FS: 12/05/2018.

name: Methods for String Instruction I
description: Fundamentals of teaching orchestral stringed instruments in school string and orchestra classes. Emphasis on sequential instruction, materials, and classroom management.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Practicum in Methods of String Instruction I
description: Practical application of string methods and materials in public and community school settings. Not auditable.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Methods of String Instruction II
description: Continued study of methods, materials, and concepts of teaching orchestral stringed instruments in school string and orchestra classes. Emphasis on rehearsal techniques and curricula.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Practicum in Methods of String Instruction II
description: Practical application of string methods and materials in public and community school settings. Not auditable   FS: 03/02/2022.

name: The Middle School Band
description: Study of teaching materials, methods, literature, and educational practices used in middle school band settings.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: The High School Band
description: Study of teaching materials, methods, literature, and educational practices used in high school band settings.

name: Workshop in Music Education
description: Selected topics in music education. May be repeated as the topic varies. Credits 1-3 per registration; 12 maximum.   CL: 2020.

name: Integrating Music into the Elementary Classroom
description: Develop activities and learning plans that integrate music into language arts, math, science, social studies, ELA, and learning for students with special needs. Apply those lessons in practicums with children.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: Wind Pedagogy II
description: Continued study of the issues in playing and teaching wind instruments in a heterogeneous class. Special study of problems unique to each woodwind and brass instrument regarding fingering and intonation.

name: Arraning for the Marching Band
description: Instruction and practice in arranging music for the marching band.

name: String Instrument Pedagogy
description: Principles and practices in teaching string instruments, including Suzuki and Rolland. Emphasis on teaching in the private studio.

name: Specialized Elementary Music Methods
description: Advanced study of Orff, Kodaly, Dalcroze, and Gordon music learning theories as applied in elementary schools.

name: Organization and Administration of Music Programs
description: Topics include materials and techniques of class teaching, equipment purchase, budgeting, recruiting, public relations, and the music library.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Practicum in Instrumental Music
description: Practical application of instrumental methods and techniques in school settings. Not auditable.   CL: 2020.

name: Recital Class
description: Music Convocation gathers the School of Music community together for shared experiences regarding different aspects of Professional Skills and Entrepreneurship, Academic Integrity and Excellence, Wellness and Safety, Performance and Collaboration, and Global Engagement. Pass/Fail grading only.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Music Advocacy I: Understanding the Power of Your Music
description: An introduction to advocacy methods, techniques and experiences to understand the positive effects of music in American society.    Pass/Fail Grading.   CL: 2020.

name: Recital Class Laboratory
description: Introduction to the literature and styles of western music.  Not auditable.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Piano
description: An introductory course in the beginning techniques of making music at the piano. One group class and one private lesson each week. This class is designed for students with no prior formal training in piano.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Singing
description: An introduction to singing, designed for students with no prior formal training in music.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Music

name: Special Topics in Popular Music
description: An investigation into the function of popular music in contemporary society. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Music Theory
description: Practice in basic written theory and aural skills. Concepts of rhythm, melody, harmony, form, and expression. Open to non-music majors. Not for credit toward major requirements in music degrees. Subdiscipline: Music (Theory and Composistion).   FS: 03/04/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Music Theory I
description: A survey of the sound, harmony, melody, rhythm, and form of diatonic tonal music of a variety of styles.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Music Theory II
description: Continuation of MUSC 115.

name: Aural Skills I
description: Development of musical independence, including sightsinging, ear training, rhythmic reading, dictation, and partsinging.

name: Aural Skills II
description: Continuation of MUSC 117.

name: Ensemble - Accompanying
description: Chamber ensembles; special ensembles of instruments and voices.  Not Auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Carolina Basketball Band
description: Ensemble of brass, woodwinds, percussion and guitar.    FS: 04/07/2021.

name: University Band
description: A large concert ensemble of brass, woodwind, and percussion instrumentalists.

name: The Marching Band
description: Not Auditable.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Music Literature
description: Listening to examples of all style periods and genres of Western music. Analysis of form and other audible style characteristics. Study of major works of the concert repertory.

name: Basic Guitar II
description: A continuation of MUSC 103 in which students learn to play the guitar as both a solo and an accompanying instrument. One class meeting and one private lesson per week.

name: Understanding the Psychology of Music
description: Various psychological and psychosocial aspects of human musical behavior, including introductory musical acoustics, perception and cognition of music, music and the brain, music processing across world cultures, music and emotions, music and human health, music in social contexts, and principles of experimental design.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Music Theory II
description: A survey of the sound, harmony, melody, rhythm, and form of tonal music of a variety of styles, expanding the diatonic framework with chromaticism.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Music Theory IV
description: A study of organization in music of the late 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries.

name: Aural Skills III
description: Continuation of MUSC 118.

name: Aural Skills IV
description: Continuation of MUSC 217.

name: Jazz Improvisation I
description: Application of aural and theoretical skills in selected jazz repertory.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Jazz Improvisation II
description: Application of aural and theoretical skills in selected jazz repertory.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Introduction to Beat Making and Digital Audio Production
description: Practice in basic audio production (signal-flow, digital audio workstations, plug-ins, virtual instruments, effects) and beat making (audio production in a digital workstation using samples, loops, and virtual instruments). Concepts of music production and prominent styles in beat-driven music.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Digital Music Creation
description: Research, analysis, and creation of digital music using techniques in commercial and production music including DAW, MIDI, samples, effects, and more. In each learning module, students will read about, listen to, and analyze model recordings in specific subgenres of commercial, production, and art music before creating their own short music track. At the end of the semester students will research, plan, and create a final project based on their interests. Topics include Introduction to DAW, MIDI & signal flow; Virtual instruments & samples; The studio as instrument, Notation; Rhythm, groove, micro-timing, & beats; Building full textures & Orchestration; Music for advertising; Underscoring for TV & film; Video game music, vamps, & cycles; Sound design; and Electro-acoustic mixture.   FS:12/01/2021.

name: Keyboard Harmony and Sight Reading Laboratory
description: Functional keyboard skills in sight reading, harmonization, transposition, and improvisation.

name: Beginning Piano Accompanying
description: Approaches to specific problems in vocal and instrumental accompanying; supervised accompanying in class.  Repeatable for credit.

name: Introduction to Singer's Diction
description: Techniques of pronunciation, phonetics, and international phonetic alphabet as applied to standard vocal repertory. Not auditable.

name: Supplemental Applied Focus
description: Applied study for advanced undergraduate performance majors with a focus in a supplemental area or concept.   FS: 06/07/2023.

name: Introduction to Music Industry Studies
description: An overview of the music industry. Students will explore a variety of music industry career paths in areas such as arts management, music products and merchandizing, public relations, music production and recording, publishing, online music distribution, and live music event organization.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Counterpoint
description: Analysis and writing in contrapuntal forms.   FS: 10/06/2021.

name: Twentieth-Century Techniques and Materials
description: Study of the techniques, materials, and organization of 20th-century music.    FS: 10/06/2021.

name: Topics in Music Theory
description: Topics related to the study of music theory. Content varies by semester and will be announced by title in the schedule of classes. The course is repeateable up to 5 times.    FS: 10/06/2021.

name: Music Composition I
description: Introduction to music composition.

name: Jazz Theory I
description: Introduction to the language of jazz improvisation: rhythms, articulations, style, harmony and melody, forms, simple analysis, chord/scale relationships, ear training and keyboard harmony.

name: Jazz Theory II
description: Introduction to the language of jazz improvisation: rhythms, articulations, style, harmony and melody, forms, simple analysis, chord/scale relationships, ear training and keyboard harmony.

name: Jazz Improvisation III
description: Application of advanced aural and theoretical skills in selected jazz repertory.   .

name: Jazz Improvisation IV
description: Application of advanced aural and theoretical skills in selected jazz repertory.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Basic Choral and Instrumental Conducting
description: A course in organizing and conducting choral and instrumental ensembles in which basic conducting technique is acquired.

name: Instrumental Conducting
description: Emphasis upon advanced baton technique and its application through practical experience with laboratory ensembles.

name: Choral Conducting
description: Further study of the techniques of choral conducting, principles of group tone production, and interpretative factors.

name: Introduction to Computer Music
description: Techniques of computer-generated music production including aspects of MIDI, digital synthesis, and music programming. Open to students in any discipline.  Not Auditable.

name: Jazz Literature
description: Study of significant jazz recordings structured to foster familiarity with important jazz stylists, improvisers, composers, and arrangers in the post-swing era of jazz history.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: History of Western Music I
description: Western music from ca. 1500 through 1750, considering musical styles, genres and forms, and the contributions of composers through historical, analytical and musical perspectives. Subdiscipline: Music - History and Literature.   FS: 11/03/2021.

name: History of Western Music II
description: Western music from ca. 1730 through ca. 1970, considering musical styles, genre and forms, and the contributions of composers through historical, analytical, and musical perspectives. Subdiscipline, Music - History and Literature.     FS: 11/03/2021.

name: An Introduction to Audio Recording Techniques
description: Basic acoustics; miking techniques; analog tape: recording, editing, mixing and duplication; signal processing.

name: Introduction to Teaching Artistry
description: This course will explore the widely held understanding of the term teaching artist. By examining examples from the Teaching Artist practice, students will identify the skills, places, and communities where teaching artists are called to work. Furthermore, students will examine the philosophies, beliefs, and values held in the Teaching Artist profession. Finally, students will investigate the necessary tensions and questions about the Teaching Artist profession within the larger music education landscape.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department chair is required for undergraduate students. Not auditable.

name: Half Solo Recital
description: Performance of a 30-minute public recital in the student's primary performance area.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Full Solo Recital
description: Performance of a 60-minute public recital in the student's primary performance area.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Innovation Recital
description: Participation in the performance of a public Innovation Recital in the student's primary performance area, combined with elements of the student's concentration (Chamber Music, Entrepreneurship, Music Technology).   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Vocal Coaching
description: A study of stylistic, linguistic, and other performance issues in solo operatic, oratorio, and recital repertoire for singers.  Not auditable.

description: An exploration of methodologies in music research, investigating any combination of historical inquiries, including archival research and score studies; ethnographic approaches; and modern techniques such as sound studies, field recordings, critical theory, and digital humanities.    FS: 10/06/2021.

name: History of Western Music III

description: Culmination of Music Industry Studies with a focus on experiential learning or research, supervised by a faculty member. FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Composition
description: Private study in music composition; may be repeated. Not auditable.

name: Form and Analysis
description: Examination of fundamental principles of musical forms; analysis of representative tonal works. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Studio Arranging and Composition
description: Instruction and practice in arranging and composing in various jazz and commercial music styles and genres. May be repeated for credit. Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Techniques and Materials of Tonal Music
description: Study of the techniques and materials of tonal harmony and voice leading with integrated ear-training component. Not auditable.   FS: 02/02/2022.

name: Post-Tonal Music Theory
description: Studies in post-tonal theoretical techniques and analysis. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Analytical Studies
description: Analytical techniques applied to music of a particular style, period, or genre. May be repeated for a total of 9 credits. Topic for any semester to be announced by title in the schedule of classes. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Seminar in Music Theory
description: Advanced studies in music theory. Individual projects. Three meetings per week. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Eighteenth-Century Counterpoint
description: Analysis and writing in contrapuntal forms with emphasis on the style of Bach. Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Sixteenth-Century Counterpoint
description: Analysis and writing in contrapuntal forms with emphasis on the style of Palestrina.  Not auditable.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Projects in Computer Music
description: Directed study in computer-music composition or research.  Not auditable.

name: Music History for Educators
description: This online course focuses on the histories and contexts of Western art music, non-Western musics, popular, and American vernacular traditions. Methodologies for studying and applying these traditions for general education will overlap with current theories of music history pedagogy.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Song Literature
description: A study of the development of the solo art song, illustrated by major works of the song writers of all major nationalities.  Not auditable.

name: Topics in Music History
description: Topic for any semester to be announced by title in the schedule of classes. May be repeated for a total of nine credits.  Not auditable.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of the Opera
description: A survey of the literature of Classic, Romantic, and modern opera, with special attention given to the recognition of the best-known works in each school. Recordings. Open to all students as an elective.  Not auditable.

name: Orchestra Literature
description: Symphony, concerto, tone poem, and other symphonic works from the Classic, Romantic, and modern repertory. Changing concepts of orchestration.  Not auditable.

name: Survey of Chamber Music
description: The literature for small instrumental ensembles from the Baroque era to the present. The string quartet, divertimento, keyboard-accompanied sonata, etc.  Not auditable.

name: World Music
description: Rhythms, scales, forms, and instrument types basic to all music. European and American folk song, African and Native American tribal music, Asian music.  Not auditable.

name: American Music
description: Survey of the music composed in the United States from the colonial period to the present. The influences of European, African, Indian, and South American musical styles.  Not auditable.

name: Piano Literature I
description: Standard piano literature including major masterpieces from 1700 to 1850. Emphasis on instrumental and stylistic developments, and historical and theoretical background for interpreting the literature of the piano.  Not auditable.

name: Piano Literature II
description: Standard piano literature including major masterpieces from 1850 to present . Emphasis on instrumental and stylistic developments, and historical and theoretical background for interpreting the literature of the piano.  Not auditable.

name: Renaissance Music
description: Western music from ca. 1300 to the early Baroque; vocal and instrumental forms, national schools, and performance practices.  Not auditable.

name: Music of the Baroque
description: Music from 1600 to 1750, including Monteverdi and Schutz through Handel and Bach.  Not auditable.

name: Music of the Classical Period
description: The works of Haydn, Mozart, and Beethoven; the music of their predecessors and contemporaries; the characteristics of the Viennese classical style.  Not auditable.

name: Romantic Music
description: The music of the 19th and early 20th centuries; the relationship of music to other arts in works such as Schubert's songs, Wagner's drama, and Berlioz' program symphony.  Not auditable.

name: Music of the 20th Century
description: Music from 1900 to the present; major trends in contemporary music.  Not auditable.    .

name: Advanced Audio Recording Techniques
description: Multi-microphone and ambisonic stereo recording techniques; multi-track recording, signal processing and audio production; digital audio. Studio and field experience.  Not auditable.

name: Fundamentals of Sound Use for Media
description: Music for use in media; midi applications and synchronization methods using time code; direct-to-hard-disc tapeless audio recording software.  Not auditable.

name: Recording Studio Techniques
description: Technology and techniques in the recording studio including use of equalizers, limiters, reverberators, compressors, the mixing console, multi-track recording, microphone techniques, and basic acoustics related to the instrumental and vocal recording process.  Not auditable.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Piano Accompanying
description: Approaches to specific problems in vocal and instrumental accompanying; supervised accompanying in class. Advanced work for experienced students.  Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Italian and Latin Diction
description: Techniques of pronunciation, phonetics, and international phonetic alphabet as applied to standard vocal repertory, with emphasis on Italian and Latin languages. Not auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Digital Audio Technology
description: A study of the theory and practice of digital audio technology including analog to digital conversion, digital storage, error correction, transmission, basic digital signal processing, and synchronization.

name: Advanced Audio Topics
description: A study of the theory and practice of audio topics such as digital signal processing, psychoacoustics, data compression, sound reinforcement systems, wireless transmission, large scale system integration, and emerging technologies.

name: Performance Pedagogy I
description: Basic concepts, techniques and materials for teaching a specific instrument.  Not auditable.

name: Pedagogy Laboratory
description: Directed teaching in laboratory and private settings.  Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Performance Pedagogy II
description: Basic concepts, techniques and materials for teaching a specific instrument intermediate studies.  Not auditable.

name: Pedagogy Laboratory
description: Directed teaching in laboratory and private settings.  Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Directed Teaching in Pedagogy I
description: Supervised teaching in a performance area.  Not auditable.

name: Pedagogy Laboratory
description: Directed teaching in laboratory and private settings.  Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Teaching in Pedagogy II
description: Supervised teaching in a performance area. Course may be repeated for credit (6 credits total).  Not auditable.   CL: 2020.

name: Pedagogy Laboratory
description: Practical experience in preparing lesson plans and teaching theory-performance classes for precollege piano students on electronic and acoustical instruments. May be repeated for credit.  Not auditable.

name: Vocal Pedagogy
description: Anatomy and function of the singing voice with practical application to teaching. Not auditable.

name: German and English Diction
description: Techniques of pronunciation for singing in German and English. Not auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: French Diction
description: Techniques of pronunciation for singing in French. Not auditable.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Music & Arts Entrepreneurship
description: Entrepreneurial skills and context for arts-based careers and business ventures. Students develop arts projects related to their interests.   FS: 06/07/2023.

name: The Alexander Technique
description: Theoretical/experimental exploration of major body systems and developmental movements to bring more articulation to the body and more awareness and physical ease in performance. For music and education students.  Not auditable.

name: Music and Money
description: A survey of the for-profit and non-profit music economies and the broader policy that drives these economies. Restricted to Music majors.    FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Music and Worship
description: The selection and leadership of music in the church service; music for the rural church; selecting and directing anthems and service music for the nonprofessional church choir; the transition from psalmody to hymnody in the 18th century; the Anglican Chant and the Lutheran Chorale.  Not auditable.

name: Workshop in Music
description: Selected topics in music. May be repeated as topic varies.  Not auditable.

name: Organ Literature I
description: Organ literature and registration from antiquity to 1750.  Not auditable.

name: Organ Literature II
description: Organ literature and registration 1750 to the present.  Not auditable.

name: Repertories of Lute, Vihuela, and Guitar
description: Solo literature for plucked, fretted instruments from the Renaissance into the 20th century. National styles, traits, and technical innovations included.  Not auditable.  Admission to upper division guitar study.   CL: 2020.

name: Business of Music
description: This course analyzes the forms and structures of both major and independent record labels. Course concepts will be reinforced with case studies, journal articles, and guest speakers.  Not auditable.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Arts Management
description: Management techniques for organizations with a musical component such as: orchestra, opera, ballet, artist series.  Not auditable.

name: Seminar in Music Entrepreneurship
description: Analyses of music businesses through the use of case studies. Restricted to Music majors.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Music Leadership Practicum
description: A practicum to design and execute an entrepreneurial music leadership project in Columbia, South Carolina. Restricted to Music majors.    FS: 02/05/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: 21st Century Performer
description: Issues confronting the professional performing musician. Topics will include performance-based income models and opportunities, program development, and promotional and supporting materials.  Restricted to School of Music students.   FS: 04/07/2021.

name: Arts Marketing
description: Arts marketing program challenges, arts organizations, building the successful private studio, marketing plans, social media and guerilla marketing, and market research.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Independent Music Teaching Business
description: A study of all aspects of the creation and maintenance of a viable independent music teaching business.  Restricted to School of Music students.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Community Engagement Through Music
description: Community engagement as it relates to music, with a focus on developing practical skills in creating engaging, interactive performances for various audiences.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Music Business Internship
description: Supervised work experience as approved by area program director. May be repeated up to 6 credits.  Not auditable.    CL: 2020.

name: Fundamentals of Naval Science
description: The Naval Service with emphasis on the mission, organization, regulation, and components of the Navy and Marine Corps.

name: U.S. Military History
description: A historical survey on the importance of military doctrine and the many roles of the United States Military covering from the American Revolution to present day.  HIST 468 or ARMY 406 may be taken in lieu of this course to meet the Naval ROTC History requirement.   CL: 2020.

name: Naval Military Laboratory
description: Military drill, cruise preparation, customs, traditions, and special areas of knowledge required of commissioned officers in the Navy and Marine Corps. Pass/Fail grading.

name: Naval Ships Systems I
description: Types, structure, and purpose of naval ships. Hydrodynamic forces, stability, compartmentation, electrical, and auxiliary systems. Theory of design and operation of steam, gas turbine, and nuclear propulsion. Shipboard safety and firefighting.   CL: 2020.

name: Naval Ships Systems II
description: Fire control systems, weapons types, capabilities, and limitations. Physical aspects of radar and underwater sound for target acquisition, threat analysis, tracking, weapons selection, delivery, and guidance. Explosives, fusing, and naval ordnance.

name: Navigation/Naval Operations I
description: Piloting and celestial navigation theory, principles, and procedures. Tides, current, weather, use of navigational instruments and equipments, and practicum.  Laboratory required.   CL: 2020.

name: Navigation/Naval Operations Lab I
description: Laboratory work in piloting and celestial navigation to complement Naval Science 301.  One hour per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Navigation/Naval Operations II
description: International and Inland Rules of the Road; relative motion-vector analysis; ship handling, employment, tactics, and afloat communications; and operations analysis.  Laboratory required.   CL: 2020.

name: Navigation/Naval Operations II Lab
description: Laboratory work in maneuvering board (vector analysis) and Rules of the Road to complement Naval Science 302.  One hour per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Evolution of the Art of War
description: A survey of military history emphasizing principles of warfare, strategy and tactics, and significant military leaders and organizations.

name: Naval Leadership and Management I
description: Theory and principles of management, focusing on the officer-manager as an organizational decision maker. Includes interpersonal skills; behavior factors; group dynamics.

name: Naval Leadership and Ethics
description: Integration of professional military competencies and qualities of effective leadership with emphasis on moral and ethical responsibilities, accountability, communications, and military law for the junior officer.

name: Fundamentals of Maneuver Warfare
description: The history of Maneuver Warfare emphasizing doctrine and techniques while enabling students to become critical thinkers and better prepare them for future service.   FS: 02/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Neuroscience
description: Function of the brain including basic neuroanatomy, neurophysiology and neurochemistry, neural systems, and psychopharmacology as it relates to behavior.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Individual Research in Neuroscience
description: Planning and execution of supervised research in neuroscience.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Senior Thesis
description: Directed research resulting in a written thesis. Completion of a minimum of 60 credit hours, including required Major courses (not incl. electives and concentration); minimum Major GPA of 3.50 and overall GPA of 3.50; consent of instructor; acceptance into BA with Distinction.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Advanced Topics in Neuroscience
description: Intensive study of topics selected from the field of neuroscience. Course may be repeated for credit under different topics.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Neuroscience Laboratory
description: Practice in the methods of scientific inquiry and the dissemination of research in neuroscience.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Nursing as a Profession
description: Introduction to the profession of nursing. Provides the framework for the development and evolution of nursing practice.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Introduction to Human Genetics for Health Care Professionals
description: A comprehensive introduction to the field of human genetics designed to raise nursing students€ awareness of the role of genetics in all areas of medical care. A clinical approach and emphasis.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Nursing Informatics
description: An integration of nursing, computer and information sciences for the support of nursing practice. Focusing on effective utilization of technology and its application to nursing practice.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Facilitative Communication
description: Examination of communication theory and development of communication skills. Focuses on non-directive and directive interviewing techniques with dyads, small groups, and families.   CL: 2020.

name: Biophysical Pathology
description: Pathology associated with biophysical alterations.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Clinical Nutrition
description: Principles of normal and therapeutic nutrition, and the role of the nurse in nutritional care.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Socio-Cultural Variations in Health and Illness
description: Diverse health care belief systems and how they influence human responses to health and illness. Focus on African-American and other cultural groups.   CL: 2020.

name: Nursing Science in Professional Practice
description: Nursing as a science; selected concepts of self-care and communication within the context of nursing science.  Transition course for registered nurse students only. Credit received for NURS 110 and NURS 210 upon completion.   CL: 2020.

name: Nursing Health Assessment
description: Cognitive skills, psychomotor skills and technologies necessary to perform health assessment.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Health Assessment
description: Cognitive skills, psychomotor skills, and technologies necessary to perform health assessment.  Laboratory required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Foundations of Nursing Practice
description: Cognitive, affective, and psychomotor skills and technologies necessary to nursing intervention.  Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Nursing Care of the Older Adult
description: Nursing care focusing on health promotion, restoration, and support of older adults. Restricted to upper division nursing students.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Clinical Reasoning in Nursing Practice
description: The process of making clinical judgments.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Application of Pathophysiology and Pharmacology in Nursing
description: Concepts of disease processes in the human body and related pharmacologic interventions. Focus on nursing assessments and interventions.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Chemical Therapeutics
description: Pharmacology with an emphasis on clinical applications within the context of the nursing process and prioritization of needs.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Perioperative Nursing
description: Perioperative care of clients with common, recurring nursing problems requiring surgical intervention.  Perioperative practicum required.   CL: 2020.

name: Essential Clinical Skills Validation
description: Review and revalidation of cognitive, psychomotor, and technological skills necessary to perform health assessment and selected clinical functions. On-campus laboratory time required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Selected Topics
description: Topics of special interest in nursing. Individual topics to be announced in schedule by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Number of credits to be contracted with instructor at the beginning of the course. Contract approved by instructor, advisor and department head is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Evidence-based Nursing Practice
description: Introduction to the language and process of research and the use of best practices to guide nursing practice.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Critical Care Nursing of Adults
description: Introduction to nursing of the critically ill adult. Application in selected clinical settings.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing
description: Nursing care of clients experiencing psychiatric/mental health problems, with focus on promotion, restoration, and support.  Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Acute Care Nursing of Adults I
description: Nursing care of acutely ill adults in a variety of settings.  Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Emerging Issues in Health Care
description: Examination of emerging health-related issues and their relevance to professional nursing practice.     FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Acute Care Nursing of Adults II
description: Nursing care of acutely ill adults in a variety of settings.  Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Maternal/Newborn Nursing
description: Nursing care of childbearing women and their neonates and families. Focus on uncomplicated pregnancy and birthing processes. Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Nursing of Children and Families
description: Nursing care of families throughout their childrearing years, focusing on health promotion, restoration, and support of their children. Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Nursing Leadership and Management
description: Concepts and principles of leadership, management, policy, and politics in delivering patient care within health care systems and the implications related to nursing practice. Relationships between policies and politics in the health field and the impact on patient care and access to healthcare.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Population Health Nursing
description: Concepts and principles of aggregate and community health.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Community-Based Clinical Practicum for RNs
description: Community-based application and synthesis of professional nursing roles and responsibilities with selected populations determined to be at risk for a variety of health-related problems.   FS: 2/1/2017

name: Senior Nursing Capstone Practicum
description: Clinical experiences in managing patient care and leading the healthcare team in a variety of agencies.  Practicum required.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Community and Environmental Assessment
description: Comprehensive assessment and analysis of a community and its environment within the framework of community health nursing.   Practicum only.   CL: 2020.

name: International Issues in Health Care and Policy
description: Provides the opportunity for students to study healthcare systems, health policy, and cultural values surrounding health care in countries outside the USA.   FS: 02/03/2021.

name: Emergency Preparedness: Implications for Health Care Professionals
description: Principles of emergency preparedness with implications for health care at the local, regional, national, and global levels.   CL: 2020.

name: Caring for Limited English Proficient Patients
description: Principles and policies for clinical practice with Limited English Proficient patients.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in International Nursing
description: Experiential field study to examine international nursing in another country.  Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of courses by title. May be repeated for credit.   CL: 2020.

name: The Rural Interdisciplinary Practicum
description: Students live and practice in a rural, interdisciplinary environment and participate in an organized community-based health care activity.   Contract approved by instructor and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Issues in Women's Health
description: An exploration of women€s health and health care concerns from multiple perspectives.   CL: 2020.

name: In-Service Education
description: Organizing, developing, implementing, and evaluating the in-service education program.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics
description: Topics vary by title, consent of instructor.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in International Nursing and Healthcare
description: Provides the opportunity for students to study education, healthcare systems, and cultural values surrounding health care in countries outside the U.S.A.   FS: 04/07/2021.

name: Palmetto Senior Capstone Experience
description: Integration of interdisciplinary program of study and general education; intensive writing and research project.    FS: 9/13/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: South Carolina Studies
description: Reading and writing about South Carolina from the perspective of multiple disciplines, incorporating elements of the student€s major and cognate.   CL: 2020.

name: Internship
description: Supervised immersion and exploration in a field related to the major, with a career, cultural, or community focus.   CL: 2020.

name: Service-Learning
description: An exploration of theories of service-learning with application of practical solutions to meet community needs.    FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Nursing Concepts, Communication, and Calculations
description: This course introduces concepts essential to basic nursing practice. Nursing's historical evolution as a profession through theory, concept and role development will be presented. An overview of medical terminology and medical calculations is provided as skills that promote patient safety within the health disciplines. Written communication skills for the professional nurse will be presented. Students will be introduced to the difference between scholarly and non-scholarly sources.

name: Foundations of Composition
description: A course in writing skills with practice in composing essays, including intensive review of grammar, punctuation, and mechanics.

name: Contemporary College Mathematics
description: Linear and quadratic equations and models, functions, exponential models, logarithms, systems of equations, fundamentals of probability and statistics.

name: Foundations of College Algebra
description: Operations on real numbers, linear equations and inequalities, quadratic equations, factoring, absolute value equations, exponential and radical expressions, graphs, and functions. Additional topics may include math study skills, logarithms, exponential functions, probability, statistics, systems of equations, polynomial division, and mathematical modeling.    CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Computer Keyboarding
description: Keyboarding using the touch method, inputting, editing, and printing. Designed for students without keyboarding skills.  Elective credit only. This course might not apply toward associate€s degrees or Columbia baccalaureate degrees.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Internet Research
description: Developing the means by which students may learn to access the Internet through mainframe and PC connections to accomplish specific research needs. This course might not apply toward associate degrees or Columbia baccalaureate degrees.   CL: 2020.

name: Foundations of Leadership
description: This course combines leadership theory with practical application, equipping students with the knowledge and skills needed to work more effectively with people, become better leaders, and reach their professional goals.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and academic dean is required for undergraduate studies. May be taken for elective credit only. May be repeated for up to 6 credits hours.

name: Contemporary Physical Activity
description: Development of skills in an identified area. Course content will vary and be announced by title.  May be repeated as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

name: Self-Defense For Women
description: Basic knowledge and understanding of the culture and context in which interpersonal violence occurs, the root causes and patterns of behavior within violent relationships, self defense against forcible attacks, making immediate decisions when confronted with an assault, and the procedures necessary after an assault has occurred.

name: Contemporary Physical Activity
description: Course contact will vary and be announced by title.  May be repeated as topics vary.   CL: 2020.

name: Jogging
description: Exercise, lectures, and self-evaluation for weight control and fitness improvement.

name: Personal Fitness and Weight Control
description: Advanced techniques for controlling weight and improving fitness through exercise, lectures, and self-evaluation.

name: Weight Training
description: Fundamentals of progressive resistance exercise training.

name: Advanced Weight Training
description: Advanced techniques.   CL: 2020.

name: Group Exercise
description: Cardio-respiratory fitness, flexibility, muscular strength and endurance, and agility through various group exercise formats while utilizing a variety of equipment.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Fitness Swimming
description: Individualized physical conditioning through lap swimming and aquatic calisthenics, games, and activities.   CL: 2020.

name: ROTC Conditioning
description: Exercise testing, technique, and leadership, program design and implementation, nutrition, individual and team competitions, and other forms of training.

name: Orientation to Physical Education
description: Experiences in a variety of physical-activity areas.

name: Badminton
description: Basic strokes and introduction to the history, rules, and strategy of the game.

name: Basketball
description: Fundamental skills of game performance. Strategy, rules, and basic offenses and defenses.

name: Bowling
description: Fundamental skills and techniques of bowling.

name: Golf
description: Basic strokes, rules, and strategy of golf.

name: Gymnastics
description: Fundamentals of gymnastics on the trampoline and balance beam; tumbling, parallel bars, rings, and the horse.

name: Handball
description: Fundamentals, strategy, and rules of handball.

name: Karate
description: Fundamentals.   CL: 2020.

name: Rugby
description: Fundamental skills for game performance.

name: Soccer
description: Fundamental skills for game performance; history, rules, and game strategy.

name: Softball
description: Fundamental skills for game performance; history, rules, and game strategy.

name: Beginning Tennis
description: Basic strokes, history, rules, and strategy of the game.

name: Volleyball
description: Recreational and competitive volleyball skills.

name: Pilates
description: Focus is placed on mind-body exercises which help strengthen and condition the muscles. Each exercise will focus on building core strength, lengthening muscles, and improving flexibility. Proper breathing will also be demonstrated for each exercise in order to achieve the maximum benefits.

name: Fencing
description: Basic foil-fencing techniques, rules, terminology, history, and etiquette.

name: Badminton/Golf
description: Students will learn to perform basic skills as well as to implement game strategies. Major consideration will be given on how to teach each sport.

name: Field Hockey
description: Fundamental skills, rules, and terminology of field hockey.

name: Football
description: Fundamental skills, rules, and terminology.

name: Racquetball
description: Fundamental skills, rules, and terminology.

name: Intermediate Golf
description: Intermediate strokes and strategies; heavier emphasis on the total golf swing.   CL: 2020.

name: Basketball/Soccer
description: Students will learn to perform basic skills as well as to implement game strategies. Major consideration will be given on how to teach each sport.

name: Intermediate Tennis
description: Intermediate skills and strategies.   CL: 2020.

name: Track and Field
description: Fundamental skills, rules, and terminology.

name: Flying Disc Sports
description: Fundamentals and strategies of disc golf, ultimate and various physical activities using flying discs in recreational and competitive situations.

name: Tai-Chi-Chuan
description: Students will learn to perform basic Tai-Chi-Chuan skills. Major consideration will be given to breathing skills and meditation to relieve stress.

name: Yoga
description: Fundamental skills and terminology.

name: Tae Kwon Do
description: Fundamental skills of Tae Kwon Do.   CL: 2020.

name: Softball/Volleyball
description: Students will learn to perform basic skills as well as to implement game strategies. Major consideration will be given on how to teach each sport.

name: Tennis/Track
description: Students will learn to perform basic skills as well as to implement game strategies. Major consideration will be given on how to teach each sport.

name: Beginning Swimming
description: Skills for safety and recreation.

name: Lifeguard Training
description: Skills of lifesaving.   CL: 2020.

name: Water Safety Instructor Certification
description: Skills, methods, and techniques to teach Red Cross Swimming and Life Saving.   CL: 2020.

name: Beginning Springboard Diving
description: Basic dives and aesthetics of springboard diving.   CL: 2020.

name: Skin and Scuba Diving
description: Safe and effective use of equipment with emphasis on principles and physical laws of diving.   CL: 2020.

name: Scuba (Open Water)
description: Certification program in open water scuba instruction: safety, emergency procedures, equipment handling, navigation, and air consumption. Includes five open water dives.

name: Beginning Stand-Up Paddleboarding
description: History and development of stand-up paddleboarding as a sport,  safety protocol, paddleboard construction and design, terminology, fitness attributes and paddling techniques.   FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Team Water Sports
description: Fundamental skills, rules, and strategies for participation in team water sports.   CL: 2020.

name: Survival Swimming
description: Skills and techniques for survival under adverse conditions.   CL: 2020.

name: Basic Keelboat Sailing
description: The course is designed to teach students to safely skipper and crew on a 20 to 27 foot sailboat with a tiller and outboard engine on lakes, bays, and sheltered waters in moderate weather conditions. Theory, history, safety, and teamwork will be emphasized.

name: Beginning Skateboarding
description: History, rules, etiquette and techniques of skateboarding.   FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Power Yoga
description: Vigorous yoga utilizing breath and movement to improve strength and flexibility.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
description: Knowledge and skills in providing artificial respiration, first aid for foreign body obstruction, one and two rescuer CPR for adults, infants, and children.

name: Advanced Open Water Scuba
description: Development skills beyond open water diving: underwater navigation, night diving, and deep diving.   CL: 2020.

name: Personal Training Preparation
description: Safe and effective methods of exercise by the application of theories and principles of exercise science.  Discussion of facility organization, legal liability, and injury prevention and treatment within the score of becoming a fitness professional.   FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Gateway to Yoga
description: Yoga philosophy, history, and asanas.  Eight Limbs of Yoga, styles, history, brain and physical anatomy and their relation to yoga practice.  Sanskrit terminology and how they apply to yoga, the yogic diet and its effect on the brain and body.    FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Intermediate Yoga
description: This course is designed to provide the historical and philosophical context of Mindfulness and how it relates to classical yoga of Pantanjali. Students will be guided in deepening their mindfulness meditation practice that includes analysis of the Four Establishments of Mindfulness and will develop an advanced asana sequence as part of their practice.    CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Fencing
description: Basic footwork and bladework for foil and pe along with more complex skills, concepts, terminology, strategy, and understanding of the rules.

name: Zumba Fitness
description: Principles of fitness interval training and resistance training applied to maximize caloric output, fat burning and total body toning with a fusion of Latin and International music-dance themes.   FS: 11/6/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Geocaching
description: History, rules, terminology, and strategy of geocaching. Strategies for seeking as well as creating geocaches.   FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Beginning Latin Dance
description: Introductory course to multiple styles of social Latin dancing including Salsa, Merengue and Bachatta. Designed to develop the skills and techniques necessary for social level Latin dancing. Emphasis will be placed on basic social elements of dance, patterns, music, and leading and following.

name: Swing Dance
description: Introduction to swing dances originating from the first half of the 20th century such as the Charleston, East Coast Swing, Lindy Hop, Jitterbug, Jive, and The Big Apple.   FS:  11/6/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Rock Climbing and Bouldering
description: Safe climbing and bouldering techniques.   Movement on rock, rope systems, anchors, rappelling, belaying, risk management, spotting and lead climbing philosophy.  Save use of equipment required for sport climbing and bouldering.    FS: 11/06/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Folk and Square Dance
description: Fundamental skills and terminology.

name: Social Dance
description: Fundamental skills and terminology.

name: Intermediate Social Dance
description: Development of skills to an intermediate level in six dances: fox trot, waltz, tango, swing, cha cha, rumba.   CL: 2020.

name: Clogging
description: History, folklore, and skills; individual steps and team routines.

name: Beginning Shag
description: Techniques and history of the Shag, South Carolina's state dance. Chronicled development, style variations, and cultural contributions are emphasized.

name: Intermediate Shag Dance
description: Introduction to more challenging shag moves for couples, based on steps, turns, spins, and passes.  Emphasis on good shag form and rhythm, male lead, female follow, and tight couple positions going through step variations. Steps include Sugarfoot, Boogie Walk, Stagger, Walkup and others.    FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Beginning Belly Dance
description: Techniques, history, terminology, and dance combinations/choreography associated with Belly Dance at the fundamental level.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Archery
description: Fundamentals of target and field archery shooting, history, scoring, and rules.

name: Equestrian
description: English hunter-style riding for intermediate students.

name: Backpacking
description: Living in the out-of-doors; gear selection, map and compass reading, backpacking, hiking, and camping.

name: Canoeing
description: Fundamentals of lake, river, and whitewater canoeing.

name: Snow Skiing
description: Fundamental skills and techniques.

name: Beginning Kayaking
description: Fundamentals of whitewater kayaking including equipment selection and use, safety techniques, strokes, Eskimo roll, river strategies, rescue procedures, and trip planning.

name: Bicycle Touring
description: Fundamental skills and techniques.

name: Rock Climbing
description: Fundamentals of rock and mountain climbing including gear selection and use, knots and rope management, anchoring systems, belaying, rappelling, climbing techniques, and safety considerations.

name: Triathlon Training
description: Intensive conditioning and cross training to achieve a high level cardiovascular fitness. Biking, running, and swimming in preparation for triathlon event.    FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Spinning
description: Spinning to obtain physiological and psychological benefits.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to the Description and Analysis of Human Movement
description: Analysis and performance of fundamental motor skills.

name: Educational Gymnastics
description: Development of knowledge and skill in educational gymnastics. Designed to establish a content base for elementary and middle school physical education programs.

name: Educational Games
description: Development of knowledge and skill in game activities appropriate for the elementary and middle school physical education game setting.

name: Educational Dance
description: Development of personal skills in the use of movement for expressive purposes. Designed to establish a content base for elementary school physical education programs.

name: Fit Carolina
description: Basic concepts associated with physical activity and the opportunities in community environments to engage in health-promoting and wellness activities.   FS: 02/06/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Physical Education for Primary Grades
description: Selection and development of appropriate content for elementary school physical education experiences.    CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy and Principles of Physical Education
description: Historical background, current problems, and publications.

name: Athletic Training Lab
description: Techniques and skills used in the prevention or protection of injury.

name: Clinical Foundations in Athletic Training
description: Basic knowledge and skill in athletic injury prevention, care, and recognition; medical terminology; fulfillment of athletic training clinical proficiencies.

name: Functional Musculoskeletal Anatomy
description: Knowledge and skill of orthopedic anatomy relative to muscle, ligament, and tendon origin, insertion, innervation, and action.

name: First Aid and CPR
description: Knowledge and skills necessary to meet the guidelines for professional certification. Skills include AED, adult, child, and infant CPR, breathing emergencies, and first aid.

name: Practicum in Physical Education Field Experiences
description: Supervised field experiences for physical educators. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.

name: Foundations of Coaching
description: The philosophical bases, leadership theory, administrative practice, and organizational problems of competitive athletics.

name: Scientific Bases of Coaching I
description: Anatomical, kinesiological, and biomechanical principles affecting performance in competitive athletics; use of biomechanical analysis techniques. Primarily for non-physical education majors who wish to coach.

name: Scientific Bases of Coaching II
description: Physiological, psychological, ethical, and sport medicine principles affecting performance in competitive athletics; application of scientific principles. Primarily for non-physical education majors who desire to coach.   CL: 2020.

name: Emergency Medical Responder
description: Knowledge and skills necessary to work as an emergency medical responder (EMR) to help sustain life, reduce pain and minimize the consequences of injury or sudden illness until more advanced medical help takes over. Appropriate decision making about the care to provide in a medical emergency; skills an EMR needs to act as a crucial link in the emergency medical services (EMS) system.

name: Coaching Basketball, Track and Field, and Soccer
Practicum in Coaching
description: Supervised practical experience in interscholastic coaching settings; concurrent seminar.

name: Practicum in the Instructional Aspects of Physical Education
description: Application of instructional principles to small peer group settings using open and closed gross motor skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Practicum in Instruction of Young Learners in Movement Settings
description: Application of curriculum and instructional principles to small group instruction with young learners.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Recreational Sports Programming
description: Current program elements and techniques in recreational sports.

name: Instructional Aspects of Physical Education
description: Instruction in physical education settings, including environmental arrangements, task presentation, content development, and feedback.   CL: 2020.

name: Instruction of Young Learners in Movement Settings
description: Development of knowledge and skills to teach physical education to young learners.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Seminar in Physical Education
description: Various topics related to current events in physical education.

name: Independent Study
description: Open to sophomores and above. Enrollment and topic to be approved in advance by advisor and instructor. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required.

name: Motor Learning in Physical Education
description: Application of cognitive, sensory, and motor processes related to learning motor skills in physical education and sport settings.

name: Practicum in Secondary School Physical Education
description: The application of curriculum and instructional principles to large group instruction in the secondary school.   CL: 2020.

name: Measurement & Evaluation in Physical Education
description: The historic background of measurement in physical education; statistical techniques to be used in scoring and interpreting tests; evaluation of measures now available in the field; and the administration of a testing program.  Available for undergraduate credit only.   FS: 12/03/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Physical Education Curriculum
description: The study of K-12 physical education school curriculum theory, issues, and design.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Teaching Physical Education
description: Analysis of teaching and learning in physical education.   CL: 2020.

name: Instruction in Secondary School Physical Education
description: Physical education content and processes for the secondary school.   FS: 04/04/2018.

name: Advanced Seminar in Physical Education
description: Advanced learning opportunities in professional physical education.   CL: 2020.

name: Teaching Health Related Physical Fitness
description: Knowledge and application of processes and principles of health related physical fitness in physical education and sport settings.   CL: 2020.

name: Physical Education for Inclusion
description: Designing physical education programs for special populations and for students with special needs.   CL: 2020.

name: Observational Analysis of Sports Techniques and Tactics
description: Qualitative and quantitative techniques to observe, describe, analyze, and evaluate human movement in physical education and sports settings.   CL: 2020.

name: The Organization and Administration of Physical Education
description: Organization of instructional, intramural, interscholastic, and recreational programs, with emphasis on criteria for the evaluation and selection of activities.   CL: 2020.

name: Human Child/Adolescent Growth
description: Human physical growth and development of children with emphasis on years 4 to 18.   CL: 2020.

name: Physical Education for the Classroom Teacher
description: Appropriate movement experiences for children. Not available for physical education majors.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Dance Performance
description: Rehearsal, choreographic analysis, and dance performance. All components of dance production--including music, costume, lighting, and scenery--will be considered.   CL: 2020.

name: South Carolina Physical Education Curriculum
description: Development of physical education programs using the South Carolina Physical Education Curriculum Materials.

name: Advanced Theory and Techniques of Coaching Football
description: An intensive investigation of current theories of offensive and defensive football. Generalship, strategy, conditioning, staff utilization, film analysis, and practice organization are covered in depth.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Theory and Techniques of Coaching Basketball
description: An intensive investigation of the latest techniques and theories of coaching basketball. Systems of offense and defense, generalship, conditioning, staff utilization, film analysis, and practice organization are covered in depth.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Theory and Techniques of Coaching Track and Field Events
description: A thorough study of the latest techniques of coaching track and field events. Isometric, isotonic, and interval conditioning theories involving the cardiovascular and muscular systems are examined to acquaint the student with varying physiological approaches to conditioning.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Theory and Techniques of Teaching and Officiating Girls' Gymnastics
description: A thorough study of the latest techniques of teaching and officiating girls' gymnastics. Balance beam, vaulting, uneven bars, tumbling, dance skills and routines, and officiating methods.   CL: 2020.

name: The Art and Science of Coaching
description: Coaching principles and application to sport programs across a variety of developmental levels.    CL: 2020.

name: Counseling Student Athletes
description: Issues facing student athletes regarding their personal and career development beyond athletics.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Pharmacy in the United States
description: This course will provide students with a comprehensive introduction to the profession of pharmacy. It will explore the history of pharmacy and its evolving scope of practice; examine educational and career pathways; and allow students to gain insights into the regulatory and ethical considerations of pharmacy practice and more.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Problems in Pharmacy I
description: Conferences, assignments, and laboratory. Elective course.  Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department head is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Current Topics in Pharmaceutical Sciences
description: Addresses recent concepts and technology in the pharmaceutical and biomedical sciences.  Assists students in interpreting and evaluating published literature; and, understanding and presenting, in oral or written formats, scientific research in the pharmaceutical and biomedical sciences.   GC: 01/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Cancer: Causes, Treatment, Prevention
description: The molecular and biochemical basis of cancer and the therapeutic approaches in the prevention and treatment of cancer.

name: Special Topics in Philosophy
description: Topics selected by the instructor for specialized study. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: An introduction to the main problems of philosophy and its methods of inquiry, analysis, and criticism. Works of important philosophers will be read.   Honors section offered.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Ethics and Values
description: A study of the moral principles of conduct and the basic concepts underlying these principles, such as good, evil, right, wrong, justice, value, duty, and obligation, as they relate to specific issues or areas of life. May be repeated as content varies by title.    CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Logic II
description: Philosophical foundations of inductive inference, including probability, statistics, and decision theory; application of the  methods and results of inductive inference to philosophical problems such as the problem of rationality, epistemology, theory confirmation, social and political philosophy.    FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Formal Logic I
description: Formal logic, including foundational logical concepts, syntax and semantics of first-order logic; derivations; applications.   FS: 12/02/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Formal Logic II
description: Intermediate topics in predicate logic, including second-order predicate logic; meta-theory, including soundness and completeness; introduction to non-classical logic   FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophical Themes in Literature
description: Selected philosophical problems as they are presented in imaginative and theoretical literature. Works of fiction and philosophical treatments of issues involved in them will be read and discussed.

name: Contemporary Moral Issues
description: Moral issues confronting men and women in contemporary society. Topics will vary but may include discussion of problems related to abortion, drugs, euthanasia, war, social engineering, and punishment of criminals.   CL: 2020.

name: Images of the Human Person
description: Images of the human person in contemporary philosophy, literature, psychology, and religion, and an evaluation of these images as norms for human conduct and social policy. Particular attention may be given to images found in specific philosophical traditions, including existentialism, Marxism, behaviorism, and mysticism.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Communicating Moral Issues
description: Moral issues confronting men and women in contemporary society and the challenges of communicating effectively about them. Topics will vary but may include access to health care, euthanasia, abortion, same sex marriage and the moral and environmental consequences of eating animals.   FS: 04/06/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Science and Pseudo-Science
description: Attempts to distinguish science from pseudo-science; inquiry into such cases as astrology, psychoanalysis, and parapsychology.

name: Ancient Philosophy
description: An introduction to the work of ancient philosophers, with special emphasis on Plato and Aristotle.   CL: 2020.

name: Greek and Roman Philosophy after Aristotle
description: Problems such as hedonism, providence, belief and evidence, and mysticism, as they appear in the writings of Epicureans, Stoics, Skeptics, and Plotinus.

name: History of Medieval Philosophy
description: Major philosophical traditions in the Middle Ages.

name: Seventeenth and Eighteenth-Century Philosophy
description: An introduction to Continental and British philosophy running roughly from Descartes through Kant.

name: Nineteenth and Twentieth-Century Philosophy
description: An introduction to Continental and British philosophy since Kant through study of the works of representative philosophers. Particular emphasis is placed on the development of Idealism, Marxism, Existentialism and Phenomenology, and analytic philosophy.

name: American Philosophy
description: The principal movements of philosophical thought from Colonial times to the present, with special emphasis on the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: Existentialism
description: An introduction to existentialist themes in contemporary philosophy, literature, psychology, and religion. The writings of existentialists such as Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Camus, Sartre, Buber, May, and Binswanger will be read and discussed.

name: Classical Origins of Western Medical Ethics
description: Examination of ancient Greek and Roman philosophical, medical, and literary works (in English) as sources for the origins of medical ethics.   Priority enrollment for Medical Humanities students.   CL: 2020.

name: Between Magic and Method: Ancient Medicine
description: Introduction to ancient medicine: science and art, theory and practice, healing and predicting.  Topics include Medicine before Hippocrates, Hippocratic medicine, holism, naturalism, medicine, religion and magic, medicine and scientific explanation, Hellenistic medicine and methodology, Galenic medicine.

name: Asian Religious Philosophy
description: A historical overview and critical introduction to the philosophical practices of Asian religions; an examination of the basic worldviews, thought frameworks, and foundational questions of the main schools of premodern Asian religious philosophy.   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Ethics
description: A study of the moral principles of conduct and the basic concepts underlying these principles, such as good, evil, right, wrong, justice, value, duty, and obligation. The ethical works of influential philosophers are analyzed in terms of these concepts.   CL: 2020.

name: Medical Ethics
description: The concepts of Person and Justice as they relate to biomedical sciences and technologies.   CL: 2020.

name: Environmental Ethics
description: Examination of principles and arguments surrounding moral issues involving the environment.   CL: 2020.

name: Ethics of Science and Technology
description: Role of ethical judgments in directing or curtailing scientific research; case studies from natural and social sciences.

name: Business Ethics
description: Ethical problems in business; application to business situations of philosophical theories of individual, corporate, and governmental rights and responsibilities.   CL: 2020.

name: Engineering Ethics
description: An investigation of ethical issues in engineering and engineering-related technology. Topics include whistleblowing, employee/employer relations, environmental issues, issues related to advances in information technology, and privacy.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Law and Religion
description: An examination and critical assessment of the philosophical concepts, issues, and questions surrounding the relationship of church and state.     FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Social and Political Philosophy
description: An overview of major themes in political philosophy such as the nature of politics, obligation, community, representation, freedom, equality, and justice.    CL: 2020.

name: Crime and Justice
description: The fundamental concepts of a criminal justice system and their philosophical bases. Rights, privacy, responsibility, and the problem of justification of state control of private behavior through punishment and therapy.

name: Philosophy of Education
description: A critical examination of the theories of education of such philosophers as Plato, Rousseau, Dewey, Newman, and Whitehead. Emphasis is on the development of a philosophy of higher education.

name: Contemporary Marxism and Society
description: Recent Marxist-inspired critics of politics, science, technology, art, advertising, and other aspects of cultural life, with comparison both to Marx€s philosophical and economic writings and to other types of contemporary criticisms.

name: Feminist Philosophy
