description: Introduces feminist philosophy and applications to philosophical problems.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Disobedience, Dissent, and Revolution
description: This course explores central philosophical issues related to resisting and opposing claimed state authority. Focus will be on classic and modern texts regarding the intentional, ethically-, or politically-motivated violation of law and on the justification of revolution.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Philosophy of Art
description: Philosophical problems relating to the arts, the nature of artworks, artistic meaning, aesthetic experience, and artistic values.   FS: 11/02/2022.

name: Philosophy and Film
description: Selected philosophical problems as they are presented in feature and documentary films.

name: Knowledge and Reality
description: Examination of skeptical attacks, critical defenses, and philosophical theories of what we know and what is to be taken as ultimate reality.

name: Mind and Nature
description: Philosophical theories about the nature of consciousness, the problem of qualia, phenomenal concepts, the explanatory gap hypothesis, higher-order consciousness, prospects for naturalistic accounts of consciousness.

name: Feedom and Human Action
description: The principal movements of philosophical thought from Colonial times to the present, with special emphasis on the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: History and Philosophy of Science
description: Philosophy and history of science and their interaction from ancient Greece to the present. Emphasis on physics, astronomy, and chemistry.

name: Philosophy of Research Design in Science and Medicine
description: A philosophical investigation of research methods used in science and medicine from systematic reviewing and randomized controlled trials to theories of sampling and causal inference.   FS: 12/6/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Formal Theories of Rationality and Their Philosophical Implications
description: Formal theories of rationality in the context of decision-making and games; uses of these formal theories to address traditional philosophical issues such as rationality, knowledge, choice, social welfare, cooperation, and communication.   FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Philosophy
description: Topics selected by the instructor for specialized study. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.    CL: 2020.

name: Writing-Intensive: Ancient Philosophy
description: Writing-intensive study in philosophy of the pre-modern period. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. As a writing-intensive course, substantial time will be devoted to developing and improving the student€s ability to write clear, well-reasoned, and compelling philosophical essays.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Writing-Intensive: Modern Philosophy
description: Writing-intensive study in philosophy of the modern period. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. As a writing-intensive course, substantial time will be devoted to developing and improving the student€s ability to write clear, well-reasoned, and compelling philosophical essays.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Writing-Intensive: Field of Philosophy
description: Writing-intensive study in one or more fields of philosophy. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title. As a writing-intensive course, substantial time will be devoted to developing and improving the student€s ability to write clear, well-reasoned, and compelling philosophical essays.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Junior Seminar in Philosophy
description: Overview of philosophical theories and debates with attention to skills in discussion and presentation and in preparing and writing a research paper in philosophy.  Topics selected by the instructor.    FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Senior Seminar in Philosophy
description: Review of central topics in philosophy serving as a capstone course for senior majors in philosophy.

name: Senior Thesis
description: Directed research resulting in a written thesis.  Senior philosophy major or double major, GPA of 3.30, permission of faculty member.   CL: 2020.

name: Internship in Philosophy
description: Supervised professional experience or research outside the classroom, involving a meaningful project or activity for the employing firm or organization and a scholarly project for the student. An Undergraduate Internship Contract is required.   FS: 06/07/2023.

name: British Empiricism
description: A historical and critical survey of the British philosophers of experience. Principal concentration is on Locke, Berkeley, and Hume.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Continental Rationalism
description: A critical and historical study of the 17th-century European philosophers. The works of Descartes, Spinoza, and Leibniz are emphasized.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Analytic Philosophy
description: A critical study of recent and contemporary works in philosophical analysis, and an evaluation of the purposes, methods, and results of this movement.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Phenomenology and Existentialism
description: A critical study of some fundamental themes in phenomenology and the philosophy of existence. Emphasis is placed on an intensive study of selected works of such writers as Kierkegaard, Jaspers, Husserl, and Heidegger.    FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Plato
description: An intensive study of selected Dialogues by Plato.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Aristotle
description: An intensive study of some of the more important of Aristotle's works.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Medieval Philosophy
description: A historical and critical study of the works of the leading medieval philosophers.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Hume
description: An intensive study of the philosophical writings of Hume, especially A Treatise of Human Nature.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Kant
description: An intensive study of the work of Kant, especially the Critique of Pure Reason.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Theory of Knowledge
description: An examination of some representative theories of truth, meaning, probability, and perception.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Symbolic Logic
description: A presentation and philosophical examination of the fundamentals of modern symbolic logic.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of Science
description: A critical examination of methods and concepts of the sciences. Topics include scientific revolutions, the unity of science, experimentation, explanation, and evidence.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of History
description: A philosophical examination of historical inquiry. Theories of historical development. The logical problems of historical explanation.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Ethical Theory
description: Survey of recent and historical developments in ethical theory with special emphasis on the meaning of ethical language and the forms of reasoning employed in discussing moral values.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of Religion
description: A critical study of selected problems in the philosophy of religion. Emphasis is placed on problems relating to the existence of God, religious knowledge, and the language of religion.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Aesthetics
description: Detailed examination of the literature on aesthetics.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of Language
description: An examination of concepts and problems such as meaning, reference, analyticity, definition, and the relation between logic and philosophy.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of the Social Sciences
description: The goals of inquiry and problems such as objectivity, reduction, value freedom, and ideology.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Metaphysics
description: Major issues in classical and modern metaphysics. Topics include the idea of first philosophy, being, substance, the problem of universals, essentialism, causation, time and space, and metaphysical method.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of Mind
description: The concept of mind, the mind-body problem, emotions and cognition, the possibility of artificial minds, theories of embodied cognition.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Mathematical Logic
description: Axiomatic development of logic and the set-theoretic foundations of mathematics.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Semantics and Pragmatics
description: Introduction to the study of linguistic meaning, including the following topics: meaning, reference, and truth; the connections among language, thought, and reality; word meaning and sentence meaning; possible worlds and modality; thematic roles; meaning and context; presupposition and implicature; speech acts; formal semantics; and cognitive semantics.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Advanced Topics in Logic
description: Philosophical problems about logic, the development of philosophical logics, and the problems surrounding them.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Philosophy of Biology
description: Examination of major conceptual, theoretical, and methodological issues in biological science. Topics include reductionism, units of selection, adaptationism, relations between evolutionary and developmental biology and between biology and society.    FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Hellenistic Philosophy
description: Survey of the major schools and trends in Hellenistic philosophy: Epicureans, Stoics, Academic Skeptics. Topics include eudaimonism, hedonism, monism, teleology, and the criterion of truth.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Virtues, Acts, and Consequences
description: Recent contributions to three central strands of ethical theory: virtue theory, deontology, and utilitarianism; historical roots and recent developments.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Concepts of Evidence
description: Systematic approaches to data analysis--Bayesian, Fisherian and decision theoretic--will be critically appraised. Applications of these theories to some problems of inductive logic: the paradoxes of confirmation, the role of simplicity, and the probability of inductive generalizations.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Jurisprudence
description: An examination of a number of philosophical problems about the law: the nature and function of rules, the difference between legal rules and other rules, the nature of reasoning from legal rules, the concept of a legal system, and the relation of law and morals.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Social Justice
description: Recent theories of distributive justice and their application to such issues as redistribution of wealth, reverse discrimination, and the conflict between liberty and equality. Authors include Rawls, Nozick, Hayek, and Popper.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Contemporary European Social Philosophy
description: An examination of European social philosophy associated with either the Frankfurt School of Social Research or contemporary French Poststructuralism.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Ecofeminism
description: An exploration of the connections between oppression of women and oppression of nature.    CL: 2020.

name: Language and Interpretation in Contemporary European Philosophy
description: Selected contemporary European philosophical movements, their views on language, and their approach to interpretation: hermeneutics, structuralism, poststructuralism.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Renaissance Philosophy
description: Humanism (e.g., Petrarca), Platonism (e.g., Pico and Ficino), Aristotelianism (e.g., Pomponazzi), philosophies of nature (e.g., Telesio, Campanella, and Bruno), and Nicholas of Cusa, Erasmus, Montaigne, and Suarez.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Health Care Ethics
description: An exploration of the ethical dimensions of patient care in the clinical setting.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Special Topics in Philosophy
description: Advanced special topics in Philosophy. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 09/14/2022.

name: The Physics of How Things Work I
description: A practical introduction to physics and science in everyday life-from concrete examples to basic physical principles.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: The Physics of How Things Work I Lab
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 101.   FS: 11/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: The Physics of How Things Work II
description: A continuation of PHYS 101 with emphasis on electricity, magnetism, optics, and atomic physics.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: The Physics of How Things Work II Lab
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 102.    CL: 2020.

name: Physics in the Arts
description: The physics of sound, color, illumination; musical instruments and photographic processes. Credit may not be received for both    PHYS 151 and PHYS 153 or both PHYS 151 and PHYS 155.   CL: 2020.

name: Physics in the Arts Laboratory
description: Laboratory work on wave motion, including acoustic, optical, photographic, and electronic measurements. Credit may not be received for both   PHYS 151L and PHYS 153L or both PHYS 151L and PHYS 155L.    CL: 2020.

name: Physics in the Visual Arts
description: Principals of optics: video, and photography, eye and vision, color, polarization, lasers, and holography.    Credit may not be received for both PHYS 153 and PHYS 151.   CL: 2020.

name: Physics in the Visual Arts Laboratory
description: Laboratory work in geometrical and wave optics. Credit may not be received for both PHYS 153L and PHYS 151L.

name: Musical Acoustics
description: The principles of musical and architectural acoustics, waves and vibrations, digital techniques for generating and recording sound, perception and measure of sound (psychoacoustics).  Credit may not be received for both PHYS 155 and PHYS 151.   CL: 2020.

name: Acoustics Laboratory
description: Laboratory work in musical and architectural acoustics.  Credit may not be received for both PHYS 155L and PHYS 151L.   CL: 2020.

name: Measurement and Analysis in Physics
description: Measurements in classical and modern physics are performed, and the analyzed results are compared with basic principles. Four hours of mixed lecture and laboratory per week.   FS: 03/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: General Physics I
description: First part of an introductory course sequence. Topics include mechanics, and selections from wave motion, sound, fluids, and heat. No previous background in physics is assumed.   FS: 6/7/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: General Physics Laboratory I
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 201.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: General Physics II
description: Continuation of PHYS 201; includes electromagnetism, and selected topics from optics, relativity, quantum physics, atomic and nuclear physics.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: General Physics Laboratory II
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 202.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Essentials of Physics I
description: Classical mechanics and wave motion. Calculus-level course for students of science and engineering.   CL: 2020.

name: Essentials of Physics I Lab
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 211.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Essentials of Physics II
description: Classical electromagnetism and optics.   FS: 12/02/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Essentials of Physics II Lab
description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations to accompany PHYS 212.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Einstein€s Relativity: Understanding by Example
description: Special theory of relativity. Algebra-based course for students of all majors.   FS: 04/04/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Principles of Physics III
description: Wave motion, optics, and thermodynamics. Calculus-level treatment; a continuation of  PHYS 212.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Modern Physics
description: Experimental foundations and general concepts of quantum theory and special relativity; with selected applications from atomic, condensed matter, and nuclear physics.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Experimental Physics
description: Descriptive statistics, scientific ethics, and design, construction, and reporting the results of experiments.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Introduction to Applied Numerical Methods
description: Introduction and application of linear algebra and numerical methods to the solution of physical and engineering problems. Techniques include iterative solution techniques, methods of solving systems of equations, and numerical integration and differentiation.    CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Relativistic Astrophysics
description: Final states of stellar evolution; white dwarfs, neutron stars, black holes. Cosmology.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.   CL: 2020.

name: Senior Thesis
description: An individual investigation in the library or laboratory or both under supervision of the major professor. The preparation of a scientific report is an integral part of the work.

name: Undergraduate Research
description: Introduction to and application of the methods of research. A written report on work accomplished is required at the end of each semester.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Quantum Physics I
description: A self-contained treatment of quantum theory and its applications, beginning with the Schrodinger equation.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Quantum Physics II
description: Advanced topics in quantum physics, plus topics in special relativity, high-energy physics, and cosmology.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Mechanics
description: Classical mechanics of particles, systems, and rigid bodies; discussion and application of Lagrange's equations, introduction to Hamiltonian formulation of mechanics.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Electromagnetic Theory
description: Field theory of electric and magnetic phenomena; Maxwell's equations applied to problems in electromagnetism and radiation.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Thermal Physics and Statistical Mechanics
description: Principles of equilibrium thermodynamics, kinetic theory, and introductory statistical mechanics.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Nuclear Physics
description: An elementary treatment of nuclear structure, radioactivity, and nuclear reactions.  Three lecture and three laboratory hours per week.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Mathematical Physics I
description: Analytical function theory including complex analysis, theory of residues, and saddlepoint method; Hilbert space, Fourier series; elements of distribution theory; vector and tensor analysis with tensor notation.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Mathematical Physics II
description: Group theory, linear second-order differential equations and the properties of the transcendental functions; orthogonal expansions; integral equations; Fourier transformations.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Computational Physics
description: Application of numerical methods to a wide variety of problems in modern physics including classical mechanics and chaos theory, Monte Carlo simulation of random processes, quantum mechanics and electrodynamics.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Experimental Physics I
description: Continuation of PHYS 310. Optical apparatus (telescope, microscope, interferometer) and advanced project planning including equipment design and budgeting.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Advanced Experimental Physics II
description: Continuation of PHYS 541. Study of topics from advanced optics, astronomy, biophysics, digital electronics, nuclear/particle physics, or solid state physics, plus conduction of a physics experiment, including a written paper and an oral presentation.   FS: 03/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Astrophysics
description: An astrophysics course for physics students. Covers the basics of observational techniques, structure and evolution of stars, interstellar medium and star formation, structure and properties of the Milky Way and nearby galaxies, and generation and transfer of radiation in astrophysical environments.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Topics in Physics
description: Readings and research on selected topics in physics. Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Global Politics
description: Introduction to theories about global politics. Issues and controversies central to global politics.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Controversies in the Politics of Global Regions: Africa
description: Social, cultural, and historical forces underlying contemporary political controversies in Africa POLI 103A, Asia POLI 103B, Europe POLI 103C,    Latin America POLI 103D, and the Middle East POLI 103E; region will be identified by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Controversies in the Politics of Global Regions: Asia
description: Social, cultural, and historical forces underlying contemporary political controversies in Africa POLI 103A, Asia POLI 103B, Europe POLI 103C,    Latin America POLI 103D, and the Middle East POLI 103E; region will be identified by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Controversies in the Politics of Global Regions: Europe
description: Social, cultural, and historical forces underlying contemporary political controversies in Africa POLI 103A, Asia POLI 103B, Europe POLI 103C,    Latin America POLI 103D, and the Middle East POLI 103E; region will be identified by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Controversies in the Politics of Global Regions: Latin America
description: Social, cultural, and historical forces underlying contemporary political controversies in Africa POLI 103A, Asia POLI 103B, Europe POLI 103C,    Latin America POLI 103D, and the Middle East POLI 103E; region will be identified by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Controversies in the Politics of Global Regions: Middle East
description: Social, cultural, and historical forces underlying contemporary political controversies in Africa POLI 103A, Asia POLI 103B, Europe POLI 103C,    Latin America POLI 103D, and the Middle East POLI 103E; region will be identified by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Politics
description: Concepts and problems involved in human relationship with governments, the nation-state, and political change.

name: Controversies in Political Theory
description: An introduction to the analysis of disputes about the nature of politics and of political ideas such as freedom, equality, and justice.

name: Controversies in Public Policy
description: An introduction to the analysis of contentious public policy questions in contemporary American society, such as welfare, gun control, health care financing, immigration, affirmative action, and/or abortion.

name: Controversies in American Politics
description: An introduction to the analysis of key issues in contemporary American politics focusing on the arguments, the groups involved, and the political factors that influence the outcome of the debate.

name: Green Explorations
description: Interdisciplinary seminar combining the intellectual exploration of ecological perspectives with the physical exploration of the local environment.   First-year students only.   CL: 2020.

name: Green Engagements
description: Interdisciplinary seminar on designing, researching, and implementing collaborative projects to promote ecological sustainability.   First-year students only.   CL: 2020.

name: American National Government
description: The formation and development of the national government, its organization and powers.  Overlay Course.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Policies and Functions of American Government
description: The policies and functions of the American national government directed to the public issues and problems of contemporary America.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Leadership Studies
description: Conceptions and models, values and pitfalls, strategies and skills of leadership and of leaders in diverse contexts

name: Language Conflict and Language Rights
description: Examination of linguistic conflict and rights, as well as centrality of language rights to human rights and personal/cultural identity.  Basic facts about language related to identity, culture, attitudes, dialects, bilingualism.  Case studies (local, national, international) with particular attention to nationalism, language revitalization, language planning.   FS: 04/04/2018.

name: Social and Political Philosophy
description: An overview of major themes in political philosophy such as the nature of politics, obligation, community, representation, freedom, equality, and justice.    CL: 2020.

name: The Political Science Discipline
description: The history and development of approaches, methods, and fields of study in political science.

name: Classical and Medieval Political Theory
description: Political theories from the Greeks to the Renaissance.   FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Modern Political Theory
description: Political theories from the Renaissance to the 19th century.   FS: 04/03/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Contemporary Political Theory
description: Nineteenth and 20th century political theories.   FS: 02/01/2023.

name: Race, Class, Gender, and Sexuality
description: Historical and contemporary power relationships in race, social class, gender, and sexual orientation.   CL: 2020.

name: Feminist Theory
description: Historical development of feminist theory and contemporary debates within feminism.    FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: International Relations
description: International political behavior and institutions.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Comparative Politics
description: Comparative approaches to political systems, behavior, and institutions.   FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: International Organization
description: An introduction to the structure and functions of international political and economic organizations. Particular attention to the United Nations and its specialized agencies, and to emerging regional communities.

name: The Conduct and Formulation of United States Foreign Policy
description: An analysis of how contemporary United States foreign policy is made and conducted.

name: Contemporary United States Foreign Policy
description: A critical analysis of selected problems of United States foreign policy.

name: National Security Policies of the United States
description: Formulation and implementation of contemporary United States defense and security policies.

name: Public Opinion and Politics
description: A broad survey of the role and development of public attitudes toward political problems in a democracy. Emphasis on the origins, manifestations, and consequences of public opinion in American politics.

name: Gender and Politics
description: Impact of gender on the distribution of power in society; foundations for intersections of gender, race, social class, and sexuality and their economic, social, and political concomitants.    CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to U.S. Racial and Ethnic Politics
description: Survey of theories of the impact of race, ethnicity, and racism on American politics, and analysis of major policies and racial group experience regarding American citizenship.    CL: 2020.

name: Film, Politics, and Social Change
description: Critical analysis of film as expression and agent of political cultural, ideology, and change.

name: American Political Parties
description: A broad survey of the role of political parties in the American political system. Following an examination of the historical evolution of party systems in the United States, primary attention is given to three aspects of contemporary political parties: the party as an organization, the party as an electorate, and the party as a governing elite.

name: Elections and Voting Behavior
description: An analysis of elections and the voting process. Topics include candidate selection, campaigning, and the conduct of elections as well as public opinion, voting behavior, and the role of elections in the democratic political system.

name: Politics and the Mass Media
description: Survey of the role in American politics of mass communications media, including the press and electronic news reporting; influence of mass media on the conduct of political campaigns, political leadership style, and public opinion.

name: Southern Politics
description: Selected political patterns and trends within the 11 states of the American South. Historical developments with the central focus on Southern politics since 1950.

name: African-American Politics
description: African-American politics from the colonial period to the present. Emphasis on voting rights and strategies to advance black representation.   FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: State Government
description: A study of state-federal relations, relations among states, state constitutions, and the structure and functions of the three branches of government. Emphasis is given to South Carolina.

name: Interest Groups and Social Movements
description: The mobilization, organization, tactics, and results of group-based politics, including latent interests and the suppression of interests.

name: Introduction to Public Administration
description: A study of the basic principles and theory of administrative structure, responsibility, and control in relation to policy making in the modern state.

name: Politics of Taxing and Spending
description: Principles and practices of financial administration, including organization, budgeting, assessment, treasury management, and debt.

name: Regulatory Policies
description: Types and limits of powers exercised by regulatory agencies; procedural law and remedies against administrative action.

name: Public Policy
description: Process of and major approaches to making public policy particularly, in the United States. Case study materials will focus on such major policies as welfare, health care, national security, and resource management.

name: State Government Internship
description: A course designed to complement internship work in state/local government by introducing students to key concepts in state and local governance and politics to best facilitate the internship experience.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Public Affairs Internship
description: A course designed to complement internship work in state/local government by introducing students to key concepts in state and local governance and politics to best facilitate the internship experience.   FS: 12/07/2022.

name: Comparative Politics of Developing Countries
description: A comparative analysis of the political problems confronting new nations, the political consequences of the breakdown of traditional society and the problems of developing new institutional forms and procedures.

name: Comparative Politics of Industrialized Countries
description: Introduction to the development, structure, and functioning of government and politics in Western Europe, the former Soviet states, and other selected industrialized countries.

name: Genocide: A Comparative Perspective
description: An analysis of the causes of genocide and the application of those insights to explain how genocide has occurred repeatedly at various times and places across the globe.

name: Topics in Political Science
description: May be repeated once as topics change.   CL: 2020.

name: Race and Science Fiction
description: Draws on science fiction to understand the contemporary history of American racial and ethnic politics and to speculate about the significance of race in America€s political future.    CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study/Poli Sci
description: Note: Prior approval of an individualized contract by the director of undergraduate studies in political science and the instructor who will supervise the project required.

name: Independent Study in Political Science
description: Prior approval of and individualized contract by the director of undergraduate studies in political science and the instructor who will supervise the project required.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study in International Studies
description: Prior approval of an individualized contract by the director of undergraduate studies in international studies and the instructor who will supervise the project required.   CL: 2020.

name: Selected Topics in Political Theory
description: Intensive analysis of a particular topic or topics. To be identified by title each semester.   CL: 2020.

name: Selected Thinkers in Political Theory
description: Intensive analysis of particular theorist or theorists. To be identified by title each semester.   CL: 2020.

name: African American Political Thought
description: Survey of many of the major schools of historic and contemporary African American political thought.   CL: 2020.

name: Democratic Theory
description: An introduction to contemporary theories and practices with focus on Western, especially American, experience.

name: The State of American Politics
description: Major factors that affect the state of contemporary American politics, including the Constitution, the Congress, the courts, the presidency, the states, federalism, political parties, special-interest groups, and the electoral process.

name: Revolution and Political Violence
description: Forms, causes, and consequences of domestic political violence with special attention to revolution.

name: Theories of War in International Relations
description: The contributions of the social sciences and social theorists to an understanding of the causes of war.

name: International Law
description: The origin, development, and principles of the international law of peace and the enforcement of these principles, the law of war and pacific settlement of disputes.

name: Law and Contemporary International Problems
description: The growth of law in several areas of increasing international concern: environmental protection, expropriation, outer space, individual rights and obligations, conservation of resources, state responsibility, and terrorism.

name: Ideology and World Politics
description: An introduction to the ideological context of world affairs, with attention to traditional democratic, totalitarian, and Third World "developmental ideologies".

name: Science, Technology, and Public Policy
description: Interaction between science and politics, the making of the national science and technology policy, and the role of public policy in promoting and managing scientific change.

name: Nationalism and Ethnicity in World Politics
description: Nationalism and ethnicity as factors in world politics, including the sources, nature, and analysis of conflicts associated with them.

name: Economic Aspects of International Politics
description: Economic problems and policies in international politics including theory of comparative advantage; international economic aid, trade and monetary issues; the United States' role in the international economy; and the functions of international economic institutions.

name: International Relations of Latin America
description: Contemporary international relations among Latin American states, including economic and political security and relations with the United States.   CL: 2020.

name: Russian Foreign Policy
description: Analysis of the development of foreign policies in Russia and other states of the former USSR with special attention to relations with Europe and the United States.

name: Globalization and Security
description: Exploration of the ways in which globalization may impact national and international security.

name: International Relations of East Asia and the Pacific
description: Political patterns and forces in the Asia/Pacific region in recent times including the process of decolonization, regional conflicts, great power relations, and economic interdependencies.

name: International Relations in Japan
description: The institutions, actors, and processes of Japan's contemporary political and economic foreign affairs.

name: Political Economy of Africa's Regions
description: The historic and contemporary political and economic processes and structures of one or more regions in Africa, such as North Africa, West Africa, East Africa, Central Africa, or Southern Africa.

name: International Relations of Africa
description: Contemporary international relations among African nations including decolonization, pan-Africanism, and movements of national liberation; Africa's role in the United Nations, relations between African states and the former colonial powers, the United States, and communist countries.

name: Foreign Policies of Selected Powers
description: Foreign policy-making institutions, processes, and policies of selected powers with special attention to the domestic determinants of foreign policy.

name: Politics and Government of China
description: Political institutions and processes of the People's Republic of China with secondary emphasis on the government and politics of the Republic of China on Taiwan.   FS: 06/01/2022.

name: International Relations of the Middle East
description: Examination of super- and great-power policies toward the Middle East; inter-regional relations and Middle East foreign relations.

name: Constitutional Law I: Institutional Powers
description: Nature and functions of the national government and its relations with the states.   FS: 06/02/2021.

name: Constitutional Law II: Civil Liberties
description: Due process and civil liberties.

name: The Judicial Process
description: A study of the growth of law, the law-making function of the courts, the structure and organization of federal and state courts, the procedures involved in civil and criminal cases, and the problems and proposals for reform in the administration of justice.   FS: 02/01/2023.

name: Moot Court and Legal Research
description: Introduction to fundamental legal research techniques and strategies applied to controversial court cases in both oral and written forms.

name: Women and the Law
description: Constitutional and statutory case law dealing with gender equality issues. Topics include abortion, affirmative action, pornography, sexual harassment, fetal protection policies, employment discrimination, and women in the military.    CL: 2020.

name: Congress and the Presidency
description: Analysis of the interaction between the legislative and executive branches within a separation-of-power system.

name: The Legislative Process
description: A study of the structure, organization, powers, functions, and problems of legislative bodies.

name: The American Chief Executive
description: Constitutional, statutory and political powers and roles of the American chief executive.

name: Roosevelt Institution Seminar
description: Analysis and discussion of contemporary public policy problems through exposure to campus experts and intensive writing and peer review.

name: Psychology and Politics
description: The role of psychology in political attitudes and behavior. Examination of individual psycho-political relationships and aggregate typologies. Particular emphasis on the psychological roots of the need for or the rejection of political authority.   CL: 2020.

name: Federalism and Intergovernmental Relations
description: The origins and evolution of the American federal system, focusing on the constitutional, regulatory, and financial entanglements among federal, state and local governments.

name: Survey Research
description: Principles and practice of survey research/public opinion polling including sampling, questionnaire design, data collection, coding processing and analysis.

name: Black Activism
description: Critical review of theories of community organizing, grassroots activism, and social movements, and examination of contemporary forms of black activism.    CL: 2020.

name: Green Politics
description: An analysis of green political thought and environmental movements at the local, state, national, and global levels.

name: Environmental Policy
description: Themes in environmental policy in industrialized nations. Analysis of issue framing, the role of the public and private tools, and conflicting perspectives. Incorporates analysis of policy process and public management.

name: Politics and Government of Russia
description: Political processes and institutions of Russia and other independent states of the former USSR.

name: Politics and Governments of Europe
description: Political processes and institutions of European nations.

name: Middle East Politics
description: Focuses on the internal politics of Middle East states; historical and cultural setting of Middle East politics, social institutions, and dynamics of the political process.

name: Politics and Governments of Africa
description: Political developments, processes, and institutions of the African nations.

name: Politics and Governments of Latin America
description: The development, principles, political thought, and politics of the several Latin American states.

name: Politics and Government of Japan
description: Political institutions and processes of Japan.

name: Research Experience
description: Working with a faculty mentor, students develop a research project and related search skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Senior Thesis
description: For intensive majors. Individual instruction in research techniques and supervised thesis preparation.   CL: 2020.

name: Selected Topics in Civilization and Culture
Methods of Political Analysis
description: Quantitative techniques in political science; levels of measurement; problems of description, causation, and inference.

name: American Political Thought
description: Themes and thinkers in American political history.

name: Politics and Ethics
description: The nature of, and relationship between, politics and ethics.

name: Utopian Political Thought
description: A critical examination of utopian and dystopian political ideas.

name: Research in Language Conflict and Language Rights
description: Research into the parameters governing linguistic conflicts and language rights issues, involving a close examination of the nexes of language and: individual and ethnic identity, culture, dialects, bilingualism. Examination of regional, national, and international case studies, with particular attention to nationalism, language revitalization, and language planning.   FS: 02/07/2018.

name: Economic Development Policy
description: The role government policies have in local and regional differences in economic performance; strategies governments and non-profits use to evaluate economic development policies; topical focus on a range of economic development policies, including land use, infrastructure, workforce development, and education.   FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Law and Society
description: The American judicial system, including the decision to resolve disputes by legal means, political influence on the legal system, the social impact of legal rulings, the relationship of the courts to other branches of government, and the applicability of higher law concepts in judicial decision making.

name: American Local Government
description: An introduction to the institutions, functions, policy-making processes, and politics of American local government.

name: State and Local Government
description: This course will examine the purpose, structure, and functions of state governments and their local subdivisions.  Requires special permission of department. Restricted to social studies teachers.    CL: 2020.

name: South Carolina Government and Politics
description: South Carolina state and local government in the context of South Carolina history and U.S. state and local government.

name: Special Topics in Political Science
description: Intensive study of special topics in Political Science. May be repeated as content varies by title.    FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Accountability and Ethics
description: An examination of the legal, political, professional, and organizational accountability demands made on administrators; the interplay of these demands with the needs for ethical decision making and integrity.    CL: 2020.

name: Perspectives on Public Administration
description: The study and practice of public administration in the United States.    CL: 2020.

name: Public Data Analysis
description: Problems of gathering and using public data for public administrators and policy analysts. Includes problems of research design and data gathering, interpretation, and use in the analysis of public problems.    CL: 2020.

name: The Public Policy Process
description: An examination of the public policy process, including the role of public officials in the process and constraints on its outcomes.    CL: 2020.

name: Financial Administration
description: Organization and techniques of governmental financial management; budgetary theories, intergovernmental financial relations.    CL: 2020.

name: Elementary Portuguese
description: Grammar and practical vocabulary necessary for fundamental communication skills. Assumes no prior experience in the language.   CL: 2020.

name: Basic Proficiency in Portuguese
description: Practice and further development of essential listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Portuguese I
description: Review of the basic principles of grammar with additional emphasis on reading and oral skills.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Portuguese II
description: Continued review of the basic principiles of grammar with additional emphasis on reading, writing, and oral skills.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Accelerated Portuguese for Speakers of Spanish
description: Accelerated Portuguese for speakers of Spanish, taught through a communicative approach. Students will develop intermediate-level oral and written communication skills in Portuguese and increase knowledge about multiple aspects of Luso-Brazilian cultures.    CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Conversation and Composition I
description: Development of advanced conversational and compositional skills through systematic grammar study and review, reading, oral activities, and film discussion.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Conversation and Composition II
description: Development of advanced conversational and compositional skills through systematic grammar study and review, reading, and the analysis of texts through both writing and oral discussion.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Luso-Brazilian Literature
description: Introduction to reading literary texts in Portuguese through carefully selected readings from different genres/periods.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Business Portuguese
description: Society and business topics in Brazil. Equally useful for non-business majors.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: The Brazilian Modern Short Story
description: Examination of Brazilian short fiction and cronicas (literary journalistic pieces).   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Social Justice in the Lusophone World
description: Contemporary social justice topics throughout the Portuguese-speaking world, including Africa and Asia.   FS: 09/08/2021.

name: Special Topics in Luso-Brazilian Cultural Production
description: Intensive study of special topics in Luso-Brazilian cultural production. May be repeated once as content varies by title. Taught in Portuguese.   FS:  06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Selected Portuguese Topics
description: Intensive study of selected topics. May be repeated for credit under different title. Taught in English. Individual topics to be announced by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

name: Intensive Readings in Portuguese
description: Intensive reading for non-majors. Graduate students fulfill their foreign-language reading requirements with successful completion of the course. Undergraduates may take the course as an elective only.     CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Psychology
description: An introduction to and survey of the basic concepts and findings within the field of psychology.   FS: 09/11/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Adjustment
description: Introduction to theories and processes underlying and facilitating human adjustment in the community, family, and workplace.   CL: 2020.

name: Professional Development in Psychology
description: Overview of disciplines and careers in psychology.  Students will discover career-related interests and options at the bachelor€s and post-baccelaureate levels and will be introduced to academic advising, curricular and extracurricular opportunities and academic resources available to support them toward their career goals.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Psychological Statistics
description: Introduction to statistical methods essential for psychological research.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Research Methods in Psychology
description: Basic principles and methodology.   FS: 04/06/2022.

name: Laboratory in Psychology
description: Laboratory in psychology in which research methods and statistical methods are integrated. One lecture and one two-hour laboratory per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Human Sexual Behavior
description: Psychological, physiological, and sociological factors of human sexual behavior and attitudes.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Marriage
description: The psychological, physiological, and social characteristics of marriage.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Women
description: Women€s experiences: childhood and adolescence, work, family, cultural images, adjustment, and social change.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Religion
description: The development of the religious consciousness and its various expressions, the psychological dynamics of growth and conversion, response to crisis, and the relation of spiritual practice to health and wholeness.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology and the African-American Experience
description: Psychological theory and research as it applies to African Americans. Explores Africentric and other perspectives and roles of culture, racism, and historical phenomena.   CL: 2020.

name: Industrial Psychology
description: Psychological techniques applied to various industrial problem areas, such as management and supervision, morale, efficiency, training, personnel selection and placement, and relations among personnel.

name: Applied Psychology
description: Uses of psychological knowledge and techniques in practical contexts; clinical, school, industrial, consumer, and environmental psychology.

name: Psychology of Consciousness
description: Theories, controversies, and research findings on the nature of various states of consciousness; topics such as sleep/dreams, hypnosis, drug-induced states, and psychic phenomena.

name: Sport Psychology
description: The role of sports in socialization, personality development and competence, including: spectator-performer interactions, motivation, competition effects; and the application of psychological techniques to performance enhancement.

name: Independent Study
description: Closely supervised project or research experience in psychology. Approved contract required. May be repeated for up to six credits. Not for psychology major credit.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of Learning and Memory
description: Research and applications concerning the acquisition of new behavior and knowledge, including accounts based on classical and instrumental conditioning and on information-processing models.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Physical Activity
description: Introduction to psychosocial factors in physical activity. Topics include mental health effects of exercise, behavior change theories applied to physical activity, and physical activity determinants and interventions.    FS: 09/09/2020.

name: Cognitive Psychology
description: Research and theories on sensory memory, attention, short-term and working memory, human learning and forgetting, imagery, long-term memory, speech perception, reading, language, thinking and problem solving, and decision making.

name: Behavioral and Mental Disorders
description: Covers the classification, diagnosis, etiological theories, and treatments of the major mental and emotional disorders.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of Developmental Psychology
description: Psychological development from conception to late adulthood. Topics include physical, cognitive, and social processes associated with development at each stage of the life cycle.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of Social Psychology
description: Introduction to theory and research in social psychology from a psychological viewpoint. Topics include social perception, social cognition, attitudes, interpersonal relationships, aggression, prosocial behavior, and group processes.   CL: 2020.

name: Men and Masculinities
description: This course provides an overview of psychological, social, physical, and emotional issues related to men's lives. Major topics include: gender construction, men and work, men and health, men in relationships, male sexualities, men in families, and masculinities in the media and popular culture.   FS: 09/09/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Survey of Personality
description: Covers the major theories and research on personality and the dynamics of human motivation.   FS: 06/03/2020.   CL: 2020.

name: Sensation and Perception
description: Processing of information from the environment. Physiological, physical, psychological, and contextual determinants of perception.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Neuroscience
description: Function of the brain including basic neuroanatomy, neurophysiology and neurochemistry, neural systems, and psychopharmacology as it relates to behavior.   FS:12/01/2021.

name: Brain and Behavior
description: How the brain mediates simple and complex behavior and how we can apply basic research about the brain to real world problems.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Health Psychology
description: Application of psychological theories and assessment and treatment methodologies for health maintenance and the diagnosis and treatment of illness.   FS: 03/03/2021.

name: Introduction to Language Sciences
description: Introduction to the linguistic component of human cognition. Properties of speech, the organization of language in the mind/brain, cross-linguistic universals, child language acquisition, and aspects of adult language processing.   FS: 12/05/2018.

name: Cognitive and Social Aspects of Bilingualism
description: Bilingual language development, social and cultural aspects of bilingualism, the bilingual brain, bilingualism throughout the lifespan.   FS: 12/02/2020.

name: Survey of Clinical Psychology
description: The scientific basis of clinical psychology. Topics include history, theory, research, ethics, and best practices. For students interested in graduate school in psychology or other mental health professions.   FS: 02/05/2020.

name: Multi-Cultural Psychology
description: This course provides an introduction to theories and research in the study of psychosocial issues of racial, ethnic and cultural groups.   FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Community Psychology
description: Application of knowledge from other areas of psychology to the study of the role of the individual in the community.   CL: 2020.

name: Community Psychology Practicum
description: Supervised, structured field experience in a community agency, applying psychological principles, theory, and research. May be repeated once for credit.   CL: 2020.

name: Internship in Psychology
description: A supervised experiential course in psychology. Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and Office of Academic Programs is required for undergraduate students.   FS: 10/05/2022.

name: Advanced Independent Study
description: Closely supervised project or research experience in psychology. Approved contract required. May be repeated for up to six credits.   CL: 2020.

name: Human Factors Psychology
description: Application of research in experimental psychology to ergonomics, the design of human-environment systems, with emphasis on work settings.   FS: 10/03/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Drug Use and Effects
description: Research and theoretical considerations of substance abuse. Pharmacological, sociological, psychological, medical, economic, forensic, and other relevant research and treatment disciplines.   FS: 12/08/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Language
description: Theories of speech perception, linguistic theories of syntax and semantics, the brain mechanisms underlying language, the development of language in children, and the role of language in thought.   FS: 10/05/2022.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience
description: Research and theories on the role of the brain in facets of cognitive behavior, including attention, short-term and working memory, perception, language, executive function, thinking, and problem solving.   FS: 06/05/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Child Behavioral and Mental Disorders
description: Theories, description, and assessment of child behavior problems and disorders; methods of intervention.   FS: 12/07/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Child Development
description: Examination of development from conception through older childhood. Specific cognitive and social processes will be given in-depth study.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Adolescence
description: Theories and research examining social, emotional, and intellectual development in adolescence. Explores influence of family, peer, school, and cultural contexts.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Early and Middle Adulthood
description: Developmental changes in abilities, personality, and behavior which occur between adolescence and old age.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Aging
description: Psychological, social, and biological phenomena associated with maturity and aging.   CL: 2020.

name: Prevention of Psychological Problems in Children and Youth at Risk
description: Etiology, prevention of, and intervention in behavioral, social, emotional, educational, and psychological problems in children and youth at risk.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychology of Children with Exceptionalities
description: Characteristics, causes, needs, and intervention strategies for children with a broad range of exceptionalities including mental, physical, social/emotional difficulties and atypical gifts and talents.   CL: 2020.

name: Nature of Students with Specific Learning Disabilities
description: Children with average/above average intelligence and specific learning impairments; diagnostic and remedial techniques. Offered by both the College of Education and the Department of Psychology.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Social Psychology
description: Intensive study of topics selected from the field of social psychology.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Sensation and Perception
description: Intensive study of topics selected from the field of sensation and perception.   CL: 2020.

name: Advanced Topics in Neuroscience
description: Intensive study of topics selected from the field of neuroscience. Course may be repeated for credit under different topics.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Neuroscience Laboratory
description: Practice in the methods of scientific inquiry and the dissemination of research in neuroscience.   FS: 12/01/2021.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience Laboratory
description: Methods of observation and experimentation in cognitive neuroscience. Two lectures and one three-hour laboratory per week.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Cognitive Psychology Laboratory
description: Practice in the experimental techniques used in the study of cognitive psychology. Two lectures and one three-hour laboratory per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Sensation and Perception Laboratory
description: Concepts and principles in the study of sensation and perception in the laboratory. Two lectures and one three-hour laboratory per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Developmental Psychology Laboratory
description: Methods of observation and experimentation on human psychological development. Two lectures and one three-hour laboratory per week.   CL: 2020.

name: Intermediate Statistics for Psychologists
description: Advanced analysis of the uses and applications of statistics to research in psychology, and interpretation of statistics in the psychological literature.   FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychological Tests and Measurement
description: Introduction to the theory and practice of measuring psychological attributes. Emphasis on test construction in a laboratory setting. Hands-on experience in designing, administering, and analyzing psychological tests and measures.     FS: 12/04/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: History and Systems of Psychology
description: Systematic approaches to psychology.   CL: 2020.

name: Selected Topics in Psychology
description: Course content varies and will be announced in the schedule of classes by title.   CL: 2020.

name: Individual Research
description: Planning and execution of supervised research in psychology. Approved contract required.   CL: 2020.

name: Individual Research
description: Planning and execution of supervised research in psychology.  Approved contract required.   CL: 2020.

name: Psychological Problems and Resilience
description: A survey of clinical disorders, their origins and characteristics. Includes a review of contemporary diagnostic systems, research, and theory.   GC: 05/23/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Public Health
description: An introduction to the history, theory, and practice of public health. Emphasis will be on the population perspective and the ecological model including the population impacts of health care systems.   FS: 11/07/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study in Public Health
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and dean of the Arnold School is required for undergraduate students.  May be repeated for up to 6 credits.    FS: 06/03/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Public Health
description: Issues and emerging themes in public health. May be repeated for a total of 9 credit hours as content varies by title.   FS: 04/05/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Public Health Capstone Seminar
description: Synthesis and application of BS/BA public health program content and competencies in a practice setting with emphasis on student identified areas for professional growth.   FS: 10/02/2019.   CL: 2020.

name: Foundations of Public Health Leadership
description: An introduction to core principles in public health leadership. Areas included are ethics, public health issues, communication issues, leadership competencies, and leadership values.

name: Transforming Health Care for the Future
description: Foundation for beginning health professions students to gain an understanding of the complexities of the health care system through experiential activities conducted in interprofessional teams and the importance of interprofessional collaboration in order to improve the system.   GC/FS: 06/19/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Helping Relationships: Fundamentals of Counseling Practice
description: Development of communication skills necessary to foster and develop effective counseling relationships.   GC: 02/27/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Culture and Disability
description: Concepts and procedures relating to disability and culture, covering relevant issues affecting racially and culturally diverse individuals with disabilities, as well as promoting sensitivity and competence. Includes implications for an array of helping professions.   GC: 02/27/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: LGBT Issues Counseling and Rehabilitation
description: Contemporary issues related to the provision of effective counseling and rehabilitation services with the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender (LGBT+) population. The focus will be on attaining a level of applied knowledge and awareness commensurate with professional practice.   FS: 11/03/2021.

name: Exploring Religion
description: Beliefs and practices of the world's religions and the methods scholars use to study them.   FS: 02/03/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Comparative Religion
description: Issues, theories, and debates that shape global religious traditions, cultures, and communities; examination of historical contexts and development, applying social scientific inquiry and methods to analyze relevant current circumstances and concerns.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Religion and Culture
description: Exploration of the dynamic relationships between selected religions and cultures.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Reason and Faith
description: Critical study of the intellectual strands leading to Western disconnections between reason and faith; the search for balance between belief and reason with emphasis on contemporary developments.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Religions in America
description: The diversity of religious traditions in America.   FS:  10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Morality, Ethics, and Religion
description: Values and ethics as developed, contested, and transmitted through a variety of religious practices.   FS: 04/02/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: History of the Devil
description: A survey of the beliefs and practices associated with the demonic and the Devil from c 500 B.C.E. to the 20th century.   FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to African American Religions
description: The variety of religious traditions of African Americans, with emphasis on the contexts in which they developed.   FS: 10/02/2013.

name: Biblical Archaeology
description: The fundamental elements of human culture as it relates to biblical archaeology.  The defining characteristics of different kinds of society through interdependency of language and culture.  The affects of modern world interests in defining / redefining this area.   FS: 11/02/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Hinduism
description: An interdisciplinary examination of the complexity of the Hindu religious and philosophical traditions covering such topics as deity, self, cosmos,    body ritual, karma, and yoga.   FS:  10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Ethics and the Good Life in Asian Religions
description: Fundamental questions of ethical and moral inquiry in the religious traditions of Asia.   FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Buddhism
description: An introduction to Buddhism from a social historical perspective that examines Buddhist religious goals and practices in the local contexts of India,    Sri Lanka, Tibet, China, and Japan.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Buddhist Meditation in Theory and Practice
description: Buddhist methods of meditation, asceticism, and similar disciplinary practices for personal and social transformation.  Examination of classic Buddhist works from diverse cultures with attention to modern American practices.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Judaism
description: Overview of Jewish experiences, beliefs, practices from a contextual point of view.   FS: 06/07/2017.

name: Introduction to Christianity
description: Introduction to the Christian religion, with emphasis on the history of the major traditions and movements that have shaped the multicultural practices and social impact of modern global Christianity.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Introduction to Islam
description: Interpretation of primary materials reflecting many dimensions of the Islamic religious tradition, such as the Qur'an, Hadith, legal, and theological and mystical writings, art, rituals, and contemporary Muslim voices.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Anthropology of Magic and Religion
description: A comparative examination of such topics as ritual, cosmology, revitalization movements, magic, witchcraft, myth, and possession.    FS: 09/14/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Global Human Religiosity
description: The human experience and expression of what it means to be religious.   FS: 11/01/2017.   CL: 2020.

name: Religion and the Arts
description: Literary, visual, and/or performance art associated with religious discourse and practice.   FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Special Topics in Religious Studies
description: Special topics in Religious Studies. May be repeated as content varies by title.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Hebrew Bible (Old Testament)
description: Modern study of the Hebrew Bible from historical, literary, and archeological points of view. Reading and analysis of texts in translation.   FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: New Testament
description: Historical and critical study of the New Testament writings, with emphasis on origins, production, and transmission.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Paul and the Philosophers
description: Paul€s teachings and practices, as shown in his letters and how these resemble  those of various cultural formations of his time, with emphasis on moral  teachings and schools of Hellenistic philosophy.

name: Gospel Literature and the Formation of Christianity
description: Gospels about Jesus from the 1st and 2nd centuries CE; analysis with attention to canonical texts as well as those not contained in today€s major canonical collections; assessment of gospel literature in competing configurations of Christianity during its formative years.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: The Life and Letters of Paul
description: A critical study in the life and thought of Paul, his letters to the early Christian churches, his role in the expansion of the Christian movement, and his continuing influence today.

name: The Writings of John the Apostle
description: Writings of the Apostle John in the context of first century Mediterranean history as well as the changing interpretations over the centuries up to and including current methodologies of academic study of these ancient texts.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Religion and Culture
description: The impact of religion on modern Western culture and, in turn, of culture on religion. Selected topics: Holocaust, Puritanism, fundamentalism, Islam, Freud, "love" wisdom tradition, "civil religion."

name: Early Christianity
description: Christianity in the 1st through 5th centuries; its formation as seen through the literature of early Christians and their detractors.   FS: 02/04/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Imagining Jesus: Antiquity to Present
description: Conceptions and representations of Jesus in antiquity up to the present; including the gospel traditions as well as literature, art, and film.

name: The Greek New Testament
description: Readings in the Gospels and Epistles.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Old Testament Prophets
description: Old Testament prophets, the nature of their prophetic experience, their place in the life of ancient Israel, their message, and their continuing theological significance.

name: Christian Theology
description: Basic Christian teachings concerning God, creation, sin, the person and work of Christ, and life after death.

name: Sex, Gender, and Religion
description: Gender and sexuality in the shaping of social and individual identity in religious contexts.   FS: 10/02/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Asian Religious Philosophy
description: A historical overview and critical introduction to the philosophical practices of Asian religions; an examination of the basic worldviews, thought frameworks, and foundational questions of the main schools of premodern Asian religious philosophy.   FS: 11/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Christian Ethics
description: Basic Christian teachings concerning human nature and conduct; historical foundations and contemporary applications.

name: Social Justice & Religion
description: Historical, contextual, and developmental aspects of social justice as a significant function of religion.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Religion and Politics
description: Relationships between religion and the structure, institutions, and content of a nation€s political processes.   FS: 03/05/2014.   CL: 2020.

name: Sociology of Religion
description: Sociological perspectives related to selected aspects of religious behavior. Includes references to non-Western religions.    FS: 12/7/2016.   CL: 2020.

name: Law and Religious Traditions
description: The study of the role of law, legal argumentation, and legal contexts in one or more religious traditions.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: God and the Gods
description: The worship of Yahweh and other deities in ancient Israel with special attention to the evolution of monotheism.

name: Religions of the African Diaspora
description: Explore development/theologies of African/African Diaspora religions; examine misunderstandings; arrive at a more sophisticated and nuanced vision of these religions and the people who hold them.    CL: 2020.

name: Hindu Devotional Traditions
description: One of the main paths to the divine in the Hindu tradition; deep devotion to a god or goddess, or bhakti, with expressions in art, poetry, mythology, theology, and ascetic fervor.    FS: 12/04/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Tantra: Sex, Power, and Bliss in South Asian Religions
description: Investigation of the Buddhist and Hindu religious ideas and practices know as tantra.  Topics include tantric views of the human body, freedom, and consciousnes; tantric use of sec, imagination, visualization, and manipulation of bodily energy; role of tantric traditions in south Asian religions and cultures.   FS: 06/12/2013.   CL: 2020.

name: Buddhist Stories, Poetry, and Films
description: Buddhist stories, poetry, novels, and films from various cultures and times examined for how they creatively convey their religious ideals. Study of great works of Buddhist writing, in English translation, analyzing their techniques and examining how Buddhists use film today for similar aims.

name: Yoga: The Art of Spiritual Transformation
description: Examination of major South Asian religions--Hinduism, Jainism, Buddhism, and Islam, emphasizing the historical context for changing religious ideals, and the commingling of traditions.

name: Religions of East Asia
description: Expansion of Buddhism beyond India, development of Confucianism, Taoism, Shinto, and other national religious expressions in China and Japan.

name: Islamic Institutions and Traditions
description: The religious, political, social and economic institutions and intellectual and scholarly traditions developed by Muslim societies throughout    Afro-Eurasia from late antiquity to the present.   FS: 12/03/2014.

name: The Qur'an and Hadith
description: Intensive study of the Qur'an and Hadith: its major themes and literary quality, with attention to a range of classical and contemporary discourses about the Qur'an, both Islamic and Western.

name: Islamic Theology and Philosophical Thought
description: Close reading and discussion of primary texts (the Qur'an, Hadith, creeds, classical theological arguments, and modern writings) on major theological problems such as salvation, God, revelation, and religious pluralism.

name: Psychology of Religion
description: The development of the religious consciousness and its various expressions, the psychological dynamics of growth and conversion, response to crisis, and the relation of spiritual practice to health and wholeness.   CL: 2020.

name: Science, Magic and Religion
description: Occultism as a link between science and religion and its central role in Western intellectual and cultural history; the historical development of the science-magic-religion continuum in the Islamo-Christian world from late antiquity to present.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Sufism
description: A survey of Islamic mysticism, its foundation in the Quranic revelation doctrines and practices, subsequent development, significance within Islamic civilization, and role in the contemporary world, both Islamic and non-Islamic.

name: Messiahs, Mystics and Rebels in the Islamic World
description: Representative messianic movements, millenarian visionaries and apocalyptic imaginings in the Islamic world from the 7th century to the present, with attention to related developments in the Jewish and Christian traditions over the last two millennia.   FS: 04/01/2015.   CL: 2020.

name: Islamic Law
description: Close reading and discussion of primary texts (scriptural, classical, and modern) and accounts of court cases, focuses on one aspect of Islamic law such as equity, violence, authority, or gender.

name: Religion and Existentialism
description: Existentialist thought as adapted by theologians to interpret religious experience and the biblical message. The movement from philosophical protest against essentialism into imaginative description of existence revealed under stress.

name: Literature and Film of the Holocaust
description: Film, poetry and literature created in response to the Holocaust as the means for a decades long cultural discussion, in European and American societies, of the moral and religious implications of the Holocaust on our self-understandings as religious and moral beings.    FS: 10/06/2021.

name: Religion in the South
description: Regional faith traditions in Southern historical-cultural context: evangelical piety, denominational tradition, revival, African-American church, Lost Cause idealism.

name: Holy Women
description: Holy women from various periods and religious traditions, and how they demonstrate the different ways communities understand ideas of holiness, from piety, martyrdom, monasticism and mysticism to social action.    CL: 2020.

name: Religion and Literature
description: Classic literary works from one or more religious traditions which have shaped and/or expressed the core ethos of a religious tradition or of the more general human concern for the religious and spiritual; and/or general literature (fiction, poetry, plays, essays, non-fiction) which incorporates religious or spiritual references, ideas, symbolism, allusions.   FS: 02/04/15.   CL: 2020.

name: Jewish History I: Late Antiquity to 1500
description: The religious, cultural, social, and political conditions that shaped the Jewish experience in the Near East and Europe from Late Antiquity to 1500.

name: Jewish History II: 1500 to the Present
description: Case studies of Jewish history in Europe, America, and the land of Israel, 1500 to the present.

name: Jews and Muslims
description: Jewish-Muslim relations in the Near East and the US; an exploration of Jewish-Muslim encounters, issues of religious law, politics, radical religious ideologies, and their repercussions for today.   CL: 2020.

name: Kabbalah: Science, Religion and Nature in Western History
description: Historical investigation of kabbalah, a philosophical system and mystical current common to Judaism, Islam and Christianity, from the medieval period to the present; focus on its formative role in early modern Western cosmology and science, and its ecological implications today.   FS: 11/04/2020.

name: Theories of Religion
description: A historical overview of major theories and approaches in the academic study of religion.   FS: 12/05/2018.   CL: 2020.

name: Independent Study
description: Contract approved by instructor, advisor, and department chair is required for undergraduate students.

name: Origins of Western Morality
